title: Permanent Full Time Labour & Employee Relations Advisor
company: PERTH AND SMITHS FALLS DISTRICT HOSPITAL
description:
About the Perth and Smiths Falls District Hospital

The two hospital sites are located in the charming and historic Perth and Smiths Falls region, within close proximity to urban centers such as Kingston, Brockville and Ottawa. On the banks of the Rideau Canal system – a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Perth and Smiths Falls District Hospital (“PSFDH”) plays an important role in the lives and well-being of the 65,000+ residents living within its catchment area. The PSFDH is an organization with an exemplary accreditation status that delivers a broad range of primary and secondary services and programs to residents of three large rural counties. The PSFDH’s mission is to provide high quality patient and family-centered care built on collaboration and partnerships.

With 750 employees, a medical staff of approximately 150 physicians, 250 volunteers and an operating budget of approximately $63.7 million, the PSFDH plays an important role in the provision of services itself, but also as part of regional initiatives aimed at creating efficiencies and better care for all patients and their families.

About The Opportunity

Reporting to the Manager of People & Culture working with the management, staff & unions to foster a positive & collaborative labour relations climate, the Labour & Employee Relations Advisor will assist the Hospital by providing expert consulting services, representation, support and advice for complex labour and employment related matters including: the interpretation and application of Collective Agreements, policies & procedures, collective bargaining, grievance handling and resolution, mediation and arbitration, conflict investigation and resolution, discipline and performance management. The incumbent will also lead and/or be an active participant in corporate and various department projects, as required that have employment law and labour relations components and impact. She/he is committed to living the Mission and Values of the PSFDH.

Follows all workplace H&S policies and procedures; wears and uses personal protective equipment; ensures deliverance of a clean and safe physical/psychological environment for patients, visitors and staff and reports workplace hazards and concerns.

Supports the Patient and Family Centered Care philosophy and participates in quality improvement, risk management and patient safety activities departmentally and organization-wide. Performs work in accordance with applicable provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and Regulations, professional standards and guidelines, and the PSFDH’s corporate and departmental policies and procedures.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Provide employee and labour relations consulting services, representation, advice and support to management/staff on relevant labour and employment related issues, including collective agreements, interpretation and application, matters involving employee discipline, performance management, harassment, conflict and other related issues
  • Analyze, interpret, and advise on a wide range of complex employment and labour relations matters and the application of various employment related documents, including collective agreements, legislation, policies, procedures, etc.
  • Conduct investigations into complaints and other matters such as harassment, discrimination, conflicts, etc., write detailed reports and recommend appropriate disciplinary and/or administrative actions, when necessary
  • Act as lead representative for the organization during various stages of the grievance procedure (including grievance investigation, research, preparation, presentation, recommendation, representation and resolution when appropriate)
  • Act as a resource for information pertaining to employee/labour relations issues in accordance with organizational policies/procedures/collective agreements
  • Ensure that grievances are administered in accordance with the collective agreement, accepted practices, established parameters, and in the best interests of the organization
  • Lead and/or support the organization in various meetings and stages of dispute resolution and other employment related forums, including grievance and arbitration hearings, conciliation, mediation, Human Rights complaints, Labour Relations Board hearings, Pay Equity disputes
  • Negotiate and/or facilitate resolutions to disputes and conflicts involving employees, unions, other institutions when required
  • Lead and/or participate in all aspects of the collective bargaining process, including research, preparation, drafting proposals, costing and negotiating
  • Coordinate, lead and act as a chairperson on various committees, including Redeployment Committees, Grievance Committees, Labour Management Committee, Job Evaluation Committee or similar committees
  • Establish positive working relationships with all clients and stakeholders including union representatives, managers, employees and others in order to foster a positive and co-operative/collaborative working climate
  • Conduct legal and other forms of research as required (i.e.: benchmarking data, preparation for local collective bargaining
  • Lead in the development and implementation of processes and tools designed to assist managers
  • Act as a resource to the Occupational Health & Safety Department, managers, union representatives, and employees in accommodation and disability related cases, as required
  • Review, develop and implement employment and labour relations policies and procedures
  • Ensure compliance with policies and procedures, legislation and collective agreements
  • Lead in ensuring implementation of contract revisions in an orderly fashion, following contract ratification
  • Advise staff/management/payroll of financial changes following contract ratifications
  • Inform staff/managers re: changes in government regulations and collective agreements
  • Lead in developing and delivering training to management on labour and employment related subjects
  • Assist with implementation of labour relations aspects of annual Human Resources Plan and other special projects
  • Counsel and advise managers concerning the management of staff
  • Interpretation of collective agreements, policies and legislation

The Ideal Candidate

  • Post-secondary education in Labour Relations or Human Resources or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience; healthcare sector experience preferred
  • Five (5-7) years’ progressive experience & responsibility in labour relations/human resources, experience in a multi-unionized environment, inclusive of experience with grievance handling, labour relations, investigations, collective bargaining, discipline & discharge, performance management
  • Demonstrated collective bargaining, conflict management and negotiation skills
  • Excellent planning, organizational, prioritization, and time-management skills
  • Significant coaching and mentoring skills
  • Excellent verbal & written communication, report-writing and presentation skills, critical thinking, conflict resolution and negotiation skills
  • Extensive in-depth knowledge/experience of legal principles, legislations, policies and labour relations management.
  • Professional Designation (e.g. CHRP, CHRL), preferred

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $73,000.00-$85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • human resources: 5 years (preferred)

title: Laundry Aide, Casual/Part Time
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We customize our care, so that it’s right for our residents and their loved ones. A funny thing happens when we encourage our residents to engage and enjoy—we do the same. This is healthy living at its finest. Join us.

Click here for This is Marquise Hospitality video!

Job Details

Start Date: ASAP
Status: Casual / Part Time
Schedule: On Call between 6am to 12pm

Location: 1800 O'Connor Drive, Toronto ON

Job Summary

How you will make an impact:

You will be responsible for performing laundry services including cleaning and distributing linens to clients.

As a Laundry Aide, you will:

  • Properly sort, wash and dry linens following the approved laundry procedures

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (Medical/Surgery Replacement) (Prim...
description:
Bi-Weekly Hours: 45 hours biweekly / Rotating shifts / non master / 4 weeks notice of schedule (Commencing Immediately until April 2023)Health PEI values the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that a diverse, equitable and inclusive work-place culture can bring. Not only does this help us deliver better outcomes, more innovation, but it also creates a safer space for our patients when our employees are more reflective of the communities we serve. It is important for us to create an environment where our employees are comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and challenging the status quo to make Health PEI a better more inclusive employer and healthcare system. We recognize we have more work to do but finding intentional ways to grow our understanding and support of those who have faced barriers due to accessibility, ethnicity, ancestry, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, language or other grounds is a key priority for us. We encourage underrepresented groups to join our team, be yourself, and help us achieve our vision of for an inclusive workplace and healthcare system.The Licensed Practical Nurse provides basic nursing care necessary for the comfort and well-being of the patient; performs various treatment procedures; participates in the development and implementation of the nursing care plan; applies Infection Control techniques; and performs other related and allied duties which contribute to the orderly and efficient operation of the departments. The Licensed Practical Nurse performs these duties under the supervision of a Registered Nurse. This LPN position provides replacement and / or supplementary nursing assistance to Surgery, Restorative Care, Medical and Palliative Care as required. This position requires a great deal of flexibility and broad knowledge of adult medical /surgical nursing. The nature of the assignment to an area may be for an entire shift or any portion thereof. Reassignment to another area of the hospital may be required and will be assigned by the General Nursing Supervisor. Surgery as the primary unit indicates the area where the LPN will be considered as part of the team for seniority, performance management, team meetings, etc.- Participate in education programs and staff meetings - Act as a preceptor to students, beginning practitioners and practicing nurses by sharing specialized nursing experiences- Recognize and respond to situations where other members of the health care team require assistance- Participates, and effectively communicate with the nursing and allied health care team.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications: - Active or eligible for registration with the College of Licensed Practical Nurses of Prince Edward Island.- Must have successful completion of the Pharmacology, Medication Administration and Health Assessment. - Must have a good previous work and attendance record.- Current in CPR, TLR, WHIMIS All Hazards Codes, and annual re-certificationsOther Qualifications: - Surgery / Restorative Care experience is preferred.- Acute care experience would be considered an asset.- Demonstrate honesty and integrity which aligns with the organizational mission, vision, and values.- Demonstrate a professional presence and model professional behavior; - Additional relevant education and experience would be considered an asset.Important Notes: Notice to all External Applicants - Health Care Workers are required to provide proof of Covid-19 vaccination as per Health PEI’s Covid-19 Immunization and Management Policy. In the event that a new hire is unable to be vaccinated as a result of a medical exemption they will be required to submit supporting documentation to Employee Health / Wellness and Safety. Please Note: Please ensure the application clearly demonstrates how you meet the noted qualifications as applicants will be screened based on the information provided. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants are expected to complete the full length of this assignment unless appointed to a permanent position.

title: Janitor, remote camp
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Imagine working in a place where thousands of people rely on your team to bring out the best in their day. Join us and know you can make it happen by creating a home away from home for our clients. You can make every day more enjoyable simply by serving a nutritious meal, or ensuring a safe living environment, or creating recreational programs for their down time. No matter what role you play with us, it will be an important one.


Why work with ESS Support Services? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading foodservice and support services company. We work with clients in the oil and gas, mining, construction, coastal logging, military and defense sectors. Coverage is as diverse as offshore oil rigs in the Gulf of Mexico, to coastal logging camps in B.C., to construction camps in the Alberta Oil Sands. Facilities are located within drill camps, mining camps, construction camps, pipeline camps, oil and gas installations and correctional facilities.


FERMONT, QC

ARCELOR MITTAL

Job Summary

Keeps buildings clean and orderly. Performs heavy cleaning duties, including cleaning floors, shampooing rugs, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Collect and dispose of trash following approved procedures and infection control plans.
  • Dust and damp mops floors following approved procedures.
  • Move equipment and furniture for proper cleaning and place furniture back in correct placement.
  • Clean assigned areas with the use of assigned materials and equipment. Sanitize all surfaces.
  • Wash walls, windows, furniture, baseboards and other items to maintain a clean, safe environment for patients, visitors and staff.
  • Seek out areas requiring cleaning; take initiative to complete the task.
  • Complete all tasks assigned by supervisor.
  • Strip, scrub, buff and refinish floors; shampoo carpet.

Qualifications:

Think you have what it takes to be part of our Custodian/Janitors? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you’ll be successful in the role:

  • Previous housekeeping/custodian experience is an asset.
  • Good command of English language, both verbal and written.
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • WHMIS and BSW Certifications an asset.

Physical ability to perform all aspects of the job.

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.


For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.

title: General help/Cashier
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Imagine a place where people work as one to create an experience that inspires many. Join us and know that you make it possible for friends, families, and co-workers to come together. No matter why they gather, we’re here to serve. Because of what we do, people share so much more than a meal. And that’s why this is so much more than a job.

Why work with Eurest Dining? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading food and support Services Company. We provide diverse, innovative dining services to corporate headquarter locations, law firms, manufacturing facilities, distribution centres and call centres. Join our commitment to providing exceptional food service to the best of business and industry.

Job Details:

Start Date: ASAP

Status: Part time

Schedule: As per operational needs

Wage: $15.20 /hr

Location: Regina, Sk, S4P 3A6

Important Information: Willing to train, Must be 19 years of age

Job Summary

How you will make an impact:
You will complete a variety of duties in the preparation and distribution of meals to service units as per the requirements of that Correctional Center along with sanitation and cleaning tasks.

As a General Help/Cashier, you will:

  • Wash, peel, and cut of fruits and vegetables per the preparation schedule.
  • Prepare, cook or pan food as per prep schedule
  • Count, weigh and measure ingredients for assigned food production area
  • Store food in designated areas following wrapping, dating, food safety and rotation procedures
  • Portion meal trays and special diet trays as per meal schedule
  • Load, deliver, collect and unload meal service carts to the pods
  • Perform general cleaning duties including carts, trolleys, dishes and pots.
  • Maintain storage areas in a clean and orderly manner
  • Work efficiently and handle all equipment and products safely
  • Cash register operations and meal ticket procedures.
  • Perform other duties during off-service hours as required.
  • Perform any reasonable request as assigned or directed by management in a suitable timeframe

About you:

  • Grade 12, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Must pass and maintain a clean criminal record
  • Possess a Food Safe level 1 certificate or provincial equivalent
  • Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbal in the English language
  • Physical ability to perform all job-related tasks
  • Ability to operate all related equipment
  • Must have excellent interpersonal skills, and organizational skills
  • Must practice good personal hygiene
  • Must be able to effectively give and receive instructions

Maintains dishes, pots, pans, trays, kitchen, work areas, equipment and utensils in orderly and sanitary condition.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Scrape and rinse food from dirty dishes and washes them by hand or places them in racks or on conveyor to dishwashing machine depending on assigned equipment. Ensures complete cleanliness and sanitation.
  • Wash pots, pans and trays based on assigned procedures. Ensure complete cleanliness and sanitation.
  • Polish silver using burnishing machine tumbler, chemical dip, buffing wheel and hand cloth depending on assigned equipment and procedures. Ensure complete cleanliness and sanitation.

title: Supportive Roommate (6 month contract)
description:
Trellis is committed to active Reconciliation in alignment with the Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC) 94 calls to action and the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP). Reconciliation is a highly valued and integrated part of our culture and work. Trellis' Reconciliation journey is intentional with meaningful engagement from all team members both collectively and as individuals.

Are you someone who is passionate about making a difference in the lives of children, youth and families? Are you a supportive, open-minded and calm human service professional? Would you enjoy collaborating with a multi-disciplinary team? Then trellis is the place for you!

Trellis is a Calgary-based social services agency that grew from the amalgamation of Boys & Girls Clubs of Calgary and Aspen Family & Community Network Society on June 15, 2020. Growing from a combined history of 117 years, trellis is building on the work of both legacy organizations to offer a continuum of 33 programs for over 9,000 people each year designed to support children, youth, adults, families and communities. The programs and services offered open a path upward for people from all sorts of backgrounds, including those caught at the intersection of society's most complex needs.

Trellis works to end youth, adult and family homelessness and creates space for belonging and exploration in our community. We provide education and employment connections and support safe home environments for everyone we serve, including youth and children whether that be in their own home or through foster care or group care. We support deeper connections by meeting people where they are, across all cultures, languages and diversity spectrums. Trellis is committed to empowering individuals and communities with the support they need to grow beyond life's challenges and reach their dreams.

The Position

Reporting directly to the Program Manager of Infinity, the supportive roommate supports the young people who reside at Infinity House, ensuring all programming adheres to best practices, and operates in an ethical manner in the best interest of the youth. The presence the roommate will bring and the consistency to the structure of the home, is important to ensuring that the youth continue to feel supported and safe. Further to this, they will ensure the program delivery remains consistent with program mission, vision, and in alignment with Trellis Society's guiding philosophies and models of practice.


The Supportive Roommate provides ongoing support and resources in a flexible, compassionate, encouraging environment. The Infinity Case Managers are responsible for all aspects of the case management of the youth, including connecting to family and natural supports, mental and physical health support, employment and education, social inclusion and recreational activities.


Infinity House is a community of reciprocity. Infinity House offers a safe home that allows for respect and equality for all of those that live within. We believe that it is important for youth to continue learning this and equally important that we role model it. Teaching kindness, authenticity, dignity and respect, and providing opportunities for the youth to learn how to give and be connected to their community is an essential life skill.

Responsibilities include:

  • Providing ongoing support in a safe environment which is aligned with program model, guiding philosophies, and best practices
  • Keep in contact with the youth throughout the week and know of their whereabouts
  • Be in the home when the youth are home (excluding time during the day that you may have to work)
  • Be available as a contact for youth in most emergency circumstances, specifically those outside of the regular business hours
  • Support youth crisis, ensuring safety planning is in place and communicated with the Program Leadership and case managers.
  • Be a role model in the house, for all living circumstances
  • Teach life skills such as cooking, cleaning, laundry, healthy relationship building, and others as needed
  • Attend monthly family dinner and house meeting
  • Assist the youth in developing their communication and problem-solving skills
  • Support youth in community appointments and meetings, including grocery shopping should they need support
  • Ensuring chores are completed and completing them if youth are not able or willing, role modeling to youth by ensuring the home is maintained in a clean and orderly state
  • Be familiar with the current case planning to support the youth in reaching their goals while in the program
  • Complete and maintain home inspections for safety
  • Support youth at medical appointments or hospital if a mental health or medical crisis occurs during stay
  • Complete Critical Incident Reports as appropriate
  • Document case notes for the clients
  • Complete all case management duties on time as required, including any data collection and reporting
  • Meet with the case managers regularly to provide and receive regular information on clients
  • Communicate & collaborate with family and natural supports as opportunities arise
  • Communicate with Program Manager all necessary pass along information
  • Appropriate communication with On-Call support in the event of a crisis
  • Other duties as required

A successful candidate will have:

  • A post-secondary degree or diploma in the social sciences/human services field. Equivalent combination of education, experience and training will be considered
  • Minimum 2 years direct work experience with vulnerable populations
  • Knowledge and understanding of the Housing First for Youth & harm reduction models
  • Knowledge of the Foyer model's philosophy and operations
  • Current First Aid/CPR
  • Current Vulnerable Sector Search and Child Welfare Intervention Check
  • Drivers Abstract, class 5, and $1 million liability insurance
  • Reliable vehicle as this position may require you to transport youth
  • Flexible work hours (evenings and weekends, holiday coverage)
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to adapt when taking into consideration each unique youth

title: newLaundry Aide, Full Time Temp
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.


You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!


Imagine working in a place that brings out the best in you and helps others feel right at home. We provide an environment that balances independence with support. We customize our care, so that it’s right for our residents and their loved ones. A funny thing happens when we encourage our residents to engage and enjoy—we do the same. This is healthy living at its finest. Join us.


Click here for This is Marquise Hospitality video!

Job Details

Laundry Aide:

Start Date: May 27, 2022

Status: Full Time Temp

Schedule: Must be available at least one day on the weekend - week one 06:00-14:00 & week two 09:00-17:00

Wage: $20.96/hr (base pay+SSO wage*)
  • (Base 15.20/hr + 5.77/hr SSO wage)
For Single Site Order Locations: + 5.77/hr
  • *Single Site Order (SSO) is subject to the direction of government and may be discontinued at any time

Location: Oyster Harbour, 1127 4th Avenue, Ladysmith BC

Important Information: Laundry experience an asset but willing to train


Job Summary

How you will make an impact:

You will be responsible for performing laundry services including cleaning and distributing linens to clients.

As a Laundry Aide, you will:

  • Properly sort, wash and dry linens following the approved laundry procedures
  • Fold, count, and stack linens following approved laundry procedures
  • Collect soiled linens along with redistributing clean linens
  • Transport supplies to include clean and soiled linen to the appropriate storage and collection areas
  • Routinely inspect linens for wear and tear, identifying worn and torn linens and following Standard Operating Procedure for damaged linens
  • Maintain the commercial and residential laundry rooms in a clean, orderly, and sanitary condition


About you:

  • Experience in housekeeping and/or laundry or equivalent combination of training and experience is an asset
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions and communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
  • Able to operate laundry equipment such as washing machines, dryers, linen press, and clothing labeler
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently or in a team setting
  • Physically able to carry out duties of the position

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

title: GENERAL HELP/CASHIER - CORRECTIONS
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Imagine a place where people work as one to create an experience that inspires many. Join us and know that you make it possible for friends, families, and co-workers to come together. No matter why they gather, we’re here to serve. Because of what we do, people share so much more than a meal. And that’s why this is so much more than a job.

Why work with Eurest Dining? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading food and support Services Company. We provide diverse, innovative dining services to corporate headquarter locations, law firms, manufacturing facilities, distribution centres and call centres. Join our commitment to providing exceptional food service to the best of business and industry.

Job Details:

Start Date: ASAP

Status: Full time

Schedule: M-F 5AM-6PM MUST WORK WEEKENDS AND HOLIDAYS

Wage: $17.00 /hr

Location: Peace River, T8S 1T4

Important Information: Benefits available, Must be able to work weekends, Require a vulnerable sector security clearance, Must be over 19 years of age, Require own transportation to site (no public transit)

Job Summary

How you will make an impact:
You will complete a variety of duties in the preparation and distribution of meals to service units as per the requirements of that Correctional Center along with sanitation and cleaning tasks.

As a General Help/Cashier, you will:

  • Wash, peel, and cut of fruits and vegetables per the preparation schedule.
  • Prepare, cook or pan food as per prep schedule
  • Count, weigh and measure ingredients for assigned food production area
  • Store food in designated areas following wrapping, dating, food safety and rotation procedures
  • Portion meal trays and special diet trays as per meal schedule
  • Load, deliver, collect and unload meal service carts to the pods
  • Perform general cleaning duties including carts, trolleys, dishes and pots.
  • Maintain storage areas in a clean and orderly manner
  • Work efficiently and handle all equipment and products safely
  • Cash register operations and meal ticket procedures.
  • Perform other duties during off-service hours as required.
  • Perform any reasonable request as assigned or directed by management in a suitable timeframe

About you:

  • Grade 12, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Must pass and maintain a clean criminal record
  • Possess a Food Safe level 1 certificate or provincial equivalent
  • Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbal in the English language
  • Physical ability to perform all job-related tasks
  • Ability to operate all related equipment
  • Must have excellent interpersonal skills, and organizational skills
  • Must practice good personal hygiene
  • Must be able to effectively give and receive instructions

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. title: Registered Nurse 1 (Medical /Palliative/ Surgery / Restorati...
description:
Successful
external applicants are eligible to receive a $5,000 financial incentive
through the Nursing Recruitment Incentive Program. Up to $10,000 in Relocation
Assistance may also be available at the discretion of the hiring manager.Bi-Weekly Hours: 60 hours bi-weekly / Rotating 8 and 12 hour shifts(Commencing immediately)Health PEI values the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that a diverse, equitable and inclusive work-place culture can bring. Not only does this help us deliver better outcomes, more innovation, but it also creates a safer space for our patients when our employees are more reflective of the communities we serve. It is important for us to create an environment where our employees are comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and challenging the status quo to make Health PEI a better more inclusive employer and healthcare system. We recognize we have more work to do but finding intentional ways to grow our understanding and support of those who have faced barriers due to accessibility, ethnicity, ancestry, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, language or other grounds is a key priority for us. We encourage underrepresented groups to join our team, be yourself, and help us achieve our vision of for an inclusive workplace and healthcare system.The nurse, as a member of the Health Care Team, assists with the assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of nursing care to promote the achievement and maintenance of each patient's optimal level of health and function; develops and maintains a high level of competency to meet the standards of nursing practice; promotes interdisciplinary team work with other professionals; performs related and allied duties, including committee participation, which contributes to the orderly and efficient operation of the department. This RN position provides replacement and/or supplementary nursing assistance to Surgery, Restorative Care, Medical / Palliative as required. This position requires a great deal of flexibility, broad knowledge of adult surgical / medical nursing, hospital policies / procedures and team leading skills. The nature of the assignment to an area may be for an entire shift or any portion thereof. Reassignment to another area of the hospital may be required and will be assigned by the General Nursing Supervisor. Surgery as the primary unit indicates the area where the RN will be considered as part of the team for seniority, performance management, team meetings, etc. Duties Include;- Demonstrate honesty, integrity, resilience and ethical decision making; align decisions with the organizational mission, vision, values and evidence; Participate in education programs and staff meetings - Demonstrate a professional presence and model professional behavior; Act as a mentor and/or preceptor to students, beginning practitioners and practicing nurses by sharing specialized nursing experiences - Provide direct care to patients and ensure the delivery of patient care utilizes evidence informed nursing practice; Educate and verify that the patient has and understands essential information and skills to be active participants in their own care - Assess and plan patient care in collaboration with the health care team; Uses critical thinking to evaluate patient care in a timely manner; Monitors the effectiveness of patient care in collaboration and consultation with other members of the health team - Develop individualized care plans, set realistic patient goals and outcome measurements; In collaboration with the patient/family determines the discharge plan, plan of care for home and links to community agencies; Assist patients to navigate health system processes and provide the patient with strategies to work within the system- Determine nursing functions that can be delegated to other personnel, assign patients and specific tasks according to scope of practice and provides clear instructions related to patient care and observation - Understand and manage others; build and support teams by fostering collaboration and cooperation to achieve results; gather information, encourage open exchange of information and use quality evidence to influence action; create a climate of continuous improvement and innovation through ideas, evidence influenced practices and emerging trends - Provide professional leadership and is accountable for competent, ethical and safe practices; establish and communicate clear and meaningful expectations and outcomes; hold themselves and others accountable for results - Recognize and respond to situations where other members of the health care team require assistance - Participate in the analysis, development, implementation and evaluation of practice and policy that guide delivery of care - Build partnerships, effectively communicate, nurture trust and model transparency
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications: - Active or eligible for registration with the College of Registered Nurses of Prince Edward Island.- Current CPR is required.- The successful applicant must have a good previous work and attendance record.Other Qualification: - Medical/Surgery experience is preferred.- Acute care experience would be considered an asset.- Additional relevant education and experience would be considered an asset.Notice to all External Applicants - Health Care Workers are required to provide proof of Covid-19 vaccination as per Health PEI’s Covid-19 Immunization and Management Policy. In the event that a new hire is unable to be vaccinated as a result of a medical exemption they will be required to submit supporting documentation to Employee Health / Wellness and Safety. Please Note: Please ensure the application clearly demonstrates how you meet the noted qualifications as applicants will be screened based on the information provided. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: EEG Technologist - EMU (69843)
description:
The EEG technologist performs neurological diagnostic monitoring procedures and tests e.g. EEG, and evoked potential tests according to the standards of the institution.
Within this role the employee is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston Health Sciences Centre (KHSC) strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do. The EEG Technologist is overseen by the Senior EEG Technologist.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Performs clinical neurophysiology studies including monitoring, data collection and recording.
  • Reviews orders for appropriateness and accuracy. Consults with physicians and/or other health care providers to solve problems and recommend changes.
  • Initiates and maintains required records and documentation.
  • Maintains certification in and performs controlled and delegated medical acts as required.
  • Provides education to patients, families and other health care workers.
  • Participates in the student programs in the role of preceptor as required. Directs, supervises and evaluates activities and care provided by students.
  • Participates in the orientation of new staff members.
  • Participates in ensuring all legislated requirements for EEG and evoked potential procedures and tests are met, including Occupational Health and Safety Act.
  • Participates in quality improvement and risk management functions, and reports adverse events/equipment failure to Senior Technologist as required
  • Documents workload measurement data.
  • Participates in department case reviews, planning and projects as required.
  • Maintains professional competence through staff development and continuing education.
  • Observes and promotes health and safety regulations of the department and hospital.
  • Participates in maintaining a clean, orderly, secure, and safe work environment.
  • Performs related work as requested.

The above duties are representative but are not to be construed as all –inclusive.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Current registration with the Canadian Board of Registration of EEG Technologists (C.B. R. E.T.)
  • B.C.L.S. required.
  • One year recent related experience preferred.
  • Must have the ability to participate in on-call duties.
  • Must demonstrate an understanding of current test procedures, technologies, and calibration methodologies
  • Demonstrated ability with above average written and verbal communication skills, including good grammar, composition and spelling.
  • Experience with computers essential.
  • Evidence of strong organizational skills with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines is essential.
  • Must have excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, courteously and tactfully with all types of people
  • Maintains confidentiality.
  • Proven ability to attend work regularly.
  • Satisfactory criminal reference check required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The applicant must be able to meet the physical requirements of the position.

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Kingston Health Sciences Centre is committed to inclusive and accessible employment practices.
If you require an accommodation to fully participate in the hiring process, please notify the Recruitment Team.

title: Registered Nurse - Part-Time Casual
description:
Company Overview

At Pathway Health, we are committed to delivering personalized care to help improve a patients' quality of life. We strive to provide patients with timely access to personalized treatment plans using advanced and clinically-proven solutions to achieve the best outcomes.

Pathway Health is one of the largest providers of out-of-hospital pain management services in Canada. We own and operate nine community-based clinics across four provinces where our team of health professionals work together to help patients by using a variety of evidence-based approaches. Our patient care programs utilize an interdisciplinary approach that includes trained pain specialists, physical and occupational therapists, psychologists, nurses and other healthcare providers. Pathway Health has also developed an expertise in harm reduction where medicinal cannabis is being used as an alternative to traditional opioids.

Silver Medical Group, a division of Pathway Health Corp is actively looking for a part-time Registered Nurse with amazing IV skills, to work out of our North York location. Flexibility is required and shifts will vary, including Saturdays, dependent on the needs of the business.

We are a publicly traded company on the TSXV.

Position Overview

The Registered Nurse, under the direction of the Nurse Lead, attending physician(s), clinic policies, and in accordance with Health Canada standards and any/all federal, provincial and municipal laws and regulations, will be responsible for all the necessary processes and procedures in the care of patients, to ensure an orderly and efficient flow is maintained daily.

All responsibilities identified below are for the Company; however, there may be some cross

over related to operating subsidiaries.

The following are ways you will make a difference

§ Function as a participating member of the multidisciplinary health care team

§ Maintain patient records on EMR, paper, or another format as determined by the Employer

§ Maintain confidentiality in accordance with all relevant policies and regulation

§ Understands and implements infection prevention practices

§ Perform routine nursing duties in accordance with company policies, procedures and provincial body standards

§ Manage patient flow in the clinic, including patient registration and assisting patient in completing admission paperwork

§ Assist doctor in clinic as needed to obtain vital signs, prepare office between patients, maintain supplies, and access records as required

§ Obtaining drug screening urine, record results and dispose

§ Complete forms as needed, communicate with other health care professionals as requested

§ Participate in Quality Assurance

§ Remain current in the area of cannabis relating to treatment, Health Canada guidelines, and current political climate

§ Preparing patients for procedures:

o Includes checking and verifying vital signs, meds, NPO status, lab results, and medical history

· Providing education to the patient and family members:

o Includes ensuring the patient and family members understand the procedure and plan of care before signing procedural consent and providing them with discharge planning/instructions

· Inserting and removing intravenous lines

· Monitoring patient patterns and vital signs during the procedure (in the x-ray room and recovery area)

· Overseeing the safety and comfort of patients before, during, and after procedures

· Providing post-procedure monitoring:

o Includes observing for signs and symptoms of complications, such as bleeding from the puncture site, pain, and/or changes in mental status or vital signs

  • Receive and review physician's orders
  • Prepare and administer specialized IV and Injection therapies
  • Support/monitor administration of IV infusion treatments in the clinic setting
  • Monitor post-injection/infusion treatments as well as chart and report on all activities to the physician and standards of professional nursing documentation

· Perform other duties as required from time to time

Required Education, Skills and Qualifications:

§ Be passionate about providing exceptional patient care

§ Be excited to work in an emerging and evolving healthcare field

§ Be in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario

§ Demonstrated ability to handle continuously changing priorities

§ Current BLS/ACLS certificate required

§ Must have effective oral and written communication skills in English, and a good understanding of customer service concepts and clinic skills

§ Must have excellent organizational and problem-solving skills

§ Experience and demonstrated skills documenting and reviewing electronic patient records preferred

§ Must be able to communicate appropriately with the patients, staff, visitors, volunteers and medical professionals

§ Demonstrated initiative and the ability to function both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team member in a fast-paced demanding environment, and effectively manage challenging situations

§ Ability to facilitate clinic functioning and smooth patient care flow

§ Ability to maintain a consistent level of productivity and efficiency

§ Commitment to on-going learning and professional development

§ Shows values consistent with CPC and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation

§ Must be physically able to perform all delegated duties

§ Ensure proper utilization of protective equipment provided and identify and reports hazards

§ Engages in ethical conduct and strives to understand and appreciate the diversity of our patient/staff population and community

§ Excellent work performance and attendance

Requirement

§ All employees /consultants / allied partners working within any of our offices or clinics must be fully vaccinated and provide proof of vaccination

§ Under health & safety legislation, employees / consultants / allied partners working within any of our clinics or places of work have an obligation to ensure the safety of themselves and those around them, which includes the assurance that they have immunity to the covid-19 virus, unless there is a medical or religious reason not to

§ If this is the case, a conversation with Human Resources is required to discuss and determine how we can ensure your protection and the protection of those around you

** Management reserves the right to change the scope of the role acting reasonably. **

Pathway Health Corp. is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all facets of our selection process.

If you are interested in exploring this opportunity with Silver Medical Group, please submit your resume and cover letter with hourly rate expectations. Only candidates selected to move forward in the hiring process will be contacted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 8 per week

Salary: From $38.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registered Nurse (RN) License (required)

title: Implementation Specialist/Project Manager
description:
The Role

Questica is on the hunt for someone with project management and process improvement knowledge to join our Professional Services team. In this role, you will work directly with clients to implement new budgeting systems using Questica’s powerful budgeting application. Ensuring that the deliverables fall within the scope of the implementation, you, with your detail-orientation and enthusiasm, will listen to customers’ budgeting needs, analyze their current processes, and implement those processes. This is an opportunity to directly contribute to Questica’s mission to transform budgets, and GTY’s mission to transform government.

Coming from different professional backgrounds, what our successful IS/PMs have in common is the ability to learn and adapt, a high comfort level with software database applications, excellence in handling data, and professionalism in a client facing commercial context. With that said, prior knowledge of public sector budgeting and/or systems implementation is a big plus.

The Responsibilities

As the title implies, this role involves two major aspects: Implementation and Project Management. Through both sides of this role, you will be:

A PROBLEM SOLVER, A COLLABORATOR,
A TECHNICAL MASTERMIND, and A BUSINESS PARTNER.

Part 1. Implementation Specialist
Lead public sector clients through every stage of product
implementation and use your analytical skills to determine gaps.

LEARN | TEACH | ANALYZE | PROBLEM-SOLVE | COMMUNICATE
  • You will work directly with customers through all stages of implementation, analyzing business needs, recommending best practice, and ensuring smooth, on-time/on-budget completion of multiple concurrent implementations
  • You will attain complete understanding of, and become subject matter expert in, Questica’s suite of enterprise budgeting systems
  • You will collaborate with clients to determine needs and make recommendations, taking detailed notes
  • You will analyze existing budgeting processes, identify gaps and improvements to be built in the system to provide an efficient and comprehensive budgeting tool
  • You will analyze client’s data, prepare for migration to Questica, load data from Excel using Questica Budget’s data load interface
  • You will be a business partner to other departments in Questica, sharing your expertise
Part 2. Project Manager
Manage multiple implementations and clarify timelines
while managing resolutions for clients.

ORGANIZE | PRIORITIZE | PROBLEM-SOLVE | COMMUNICATE
  • You will ensure the orderly implementation of our products from end of sales process through to fully utilizing Questica’s budget products
  • You will clarify timelines and mutual needs, track against plan – regular communications
  • You will identify, assess, and prioritize implementation issues, managing to resolution – work internally to get the best result for your clients
The Rewards:
Here’s what we will do for YOU:
  • Teach you. At Questica, we value and reward continuous learning, offering all the resources and tools you need to get ramped up and set you up for success.
  • Reward you. All of Questica’s employees are paid competitive salaries (and we only expect an honest 40-hour work week for it).
  • Take care of you. We offer a comprehensive benefits package a company-sponsored RSP program!
  • Set you free. We carefully foster a work environment where employees have a safe space for creative and intellectual freedom, and the opportunity to work cross-functionally,
The Right Fit

The role is multi-skilled, and you are not expected to start on day one with competence in all areas. Even if some but not all the skills, education, experience, and core competencies below resonate with you, you might be the right fit and we want to get to know you!

Education & Experience
  • You have a post-secondary diploma/degree or significant work experience, ideally in finance or IT systems
  • You have significant experience in one or more aspects of software application delivery (systems implementation, project management, analysis, QA, training, etc.)
Skills:
  • You are able to conduct data analysis and possess proficiency with Excel
  • You have self-confidence and the ability to take the lead in a workshop environment
  • You have superior oral and written communication skills; and are extremely well-organized
  • You are able to work with managerial support but little oversight – you are assertive decision maker, self-starter
  • You have the ability to balance multiple projects and deadlines, while maintaining high quality of work
  • You are able to remain professional and courteous with customers at all times
  • … and you’re commercially savvy!
Bonuses:
  • Municipal / healthcare / education budgeting experience
  • Process improvement and budgeting methodologies, specifically grant accounting, budget allocations, projections and forecasting
  • Experience in helping clients deal with change
  • Hands-on use and implementation of financial planning applications (web based is a plus)
  • Design and documentation of reports generated from relational databases – ability to author reports (SSRS or PowerBI) a significant plus
  • Familiarity with Autotask, Asana, or similar software for project tracking and time management
Core Competencies: Communication, Learning-Oriented, Problem Solving, Independent & Team-Oriented, Technically-Savvy, Active Listening, Curiosity, Self-Confidence, Leadership, Analytical

Location & Travel
With COVID-19, the Questica team is taking precautions and employees are temporarily working from home. When it's safe to return, our ideal candidates will work in a hybrid model at Questica’s beautiful new office in Oakville, Ontario. Questica will give consideration to excellent candidates living elsewhere in North America, working from their own fully equipped home office.
Once the COVID situation is resolved, the position requires occasional travel, within the USA and Canada. In most cases, you will be the person determining what travel is required and when.
About Questica
Questica is the recognized leader in budgeting and performance management software. Hundreds of government agencies, K-12 schools, universities, colleges, hospitals, healthcare facilities and non-profit organizations throughout North America have opted for smarter planning, budgeting, management, transparency, sharing and engagement using our budget, performance and data visualization solutions.

We are a well-established entrepreneurial company of 100-plus employees, offering a modern, state-of-the-art workplace in Oakville, Ontario. We maintain a focus on distinct, best-of-breed software development and implementation, along with exceptional customer service.

A NASDAQ listed GovTech100 Company, GTY is a leading provider of SaaS/Cloud solutions for the public sector. Through its six subsidiaries, GTY offers an intuitive cloud-based suite of solutions for state and local governments, spanning functions in procurement, payments, grant management, budgeting, and permitting.

title: Registered Nurse 1 (Medical / Palliative / Surgery / Restora...
description:
Successful external applicants are eligible to receive a $5,000 financial incentive through the Nursing Recruitment Incentive Program. Up to $10,000 in Relocation Assistance may also be available at the discretion of the hiring manager.Bi-Weekly Hours: 37.5 hours biweekly / Rotating 8 and 12 hour shifts.(Commencing Immediately)Health PEI values the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that a diverse, equitable and inclusive work-place culture can bring. Not only does this help us deliver better outcomes, more innovation, but it also creates a safer space for our patients when our employees are more reflective of the communities we serve. It is important for us to create an environment where our employees are comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and challenging the status quo to make Health PEI a better more inclusive employer and healthcare system. We recognize we have more work to do but finding intentional ways to grow our understanding and support of those who have faced barriers due to accessibility, ethnicity, ancestry, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, language or other grounds is a key priority for us. We encourage underrepresented groups to join our team, be yourself, and help us achieve our vision of for an inclusive workplace and healthcare system.The nurse, as a member of the Health Care Team, assists with the assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of nursing care to promote the achievement and maintenance of each patient's optimal level of health and function; develops and maintains a high level of competency to meet the standards of nursing practice; promotes interdisciplinary team work with other professionals; performs related and allied duties, including committee participation, which contributes to the orderly and efficient operation of the department. This RN position provides replacement and/or supplementary nursing assistance to Surgery, Restorative Care, Medical / Palliative as required. This position requires a great deal of flexibility, broad knowledge of adult surgical / medical nursing, hospital policies / procedures and team leading skills. The nature of the assignment to an area may be for an entire shift or any portion thereof. Reassignment to another area of the hospital may be required and will be assigned by the General Nursing Supervisor. Surgery as the primary unit indicates the area where the RN will be considered as part of the team for seniority, performance management, team meetings, etc. Duties Include;- Demonstrate honesty, integrity, resilience and ethical decision making; align decisions with the organizational mission, vision, values and evidence; - Participate in education programs and staff meetings;- Demonstrate a professional presence and model professional behavior; - Act as a mentor and/or preceptor to students, beginning practitioners and practicing nurses by sharing specialized nursing experiences- Provide direct care to patients and ensure the delivery of patient care utilizes evidence informed nursing practice; Educate and verify that the patient has and understands essential information and skills to be active participants in their own care - Assess and plan patient care in collaboration with the health care team; Uses critical thinking to evaluate patient care in a timely manner; - Monitors the effectiveness of patient care in collaboration and consultation with other members of the health team - Develop individualized care plans, set realistic patient goals and outcome measurements; In collaboration with the patient/family determines the discharge plan, plan of care for home and links to community agencies; Assist patients to navigate health system processes and provide the patient with strategies to work within the system- Determine nursing functions that can be delegated to other personnel, assign patients and specific tasks according to scope of practice and provides clear instructions related to patient care and observation - Understand and manage others; build and support teams by fostering collaboration and cooperation to achieve results; gather information, encourage open exchange of information and use quality evidence to influence action; create a climate of continuous improvement and innovation through ideas, evidence influenced practices and emerging trends - Provide professional leadership and is accountable for competent, ethical and safe practices; establish and communicate clear and meaningful expectations and outcomes; hold themselves and others accountable for results - Recognize and respond to situations where other members of the health care team require assistance - Participate in the analysis, development, implementation and evaluation of practice and policy that guide delivery of care- Build partnerships, effectively communicate, nurture trust and model transparency
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications: - Active or eligible for registration with the College of Registered Nurses of Prince Edward Island.- Current CPR is required.- The successful applicant must have a good previous work and attendance record.Other Qualification: - Medical/Surgery experience is preferred.- Acute care experience would be considered an asset.- Additional relevant education and experience would be considered an asset.Notice to all External Applicants - Health Care Workers are required to provide proof of Covid-19 vaccination as per Health PEI’s Covid-19 Immunization and Management Policy. In the event that a new hire is unable to be vaccinated as a result of a medical exemption they will be required to submit supporting documentation to Employee Health / Wellness and Safety. Please Note: Please ensure the application clearly demonstrates how you meet the noted qualifications as applicants will be screened based on the information provided. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: newFood Service Worker
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Imagine a place where people work as one to create an experience that inspires many. Join us and know that you make it possible for friends, families, and co-workers to come together. No matter why they gather, we’re here to serve. Because of what we do, people share so much more than a meal. And that’s why this is so much more than a job.

Why work with Eurest Dining? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading food and support Services Company. We provide diverse, innovative dining services to corporate headquarter locations, law firms, manufacturing facilities, distribution centres and call centres. Join our commitment to providing exceptional food service to the best of business and industry.

Job Details

Status: Full Time

Schedule: Monday to Sunday 9:30AM-6:00PM

Wage: $16.37/ Hour

Location: 200 Enterprise Way, Oliver, BC V0H 1T2

Job Summary

How you will make an impact:
You will complete a variety of duties in the preparation and distribution of meals to service units as per the requirements of that Correctional Center along with sanitation and cleaning tasks.

As a General Help/Cashier, you will:

  • Wash, peel, and cut of fruits and vegetables per the preparation schedule.
  • Prepare, cook or pan food as per prep schedule
  • Count, weigh and measure ingredients for assigned food production area
  • Store food in designated areas following wrapping, dating, food safety and rotation procedures
  • Portion meal trays and special diet trays as per meal schedule
  • Load, deliver, collect and unload meal service carts to the pods
  • Perform general cleaning duties including carts, trolleys, dishes and pots.
  • Maintain storage areas in a clean and orderly manner
  • Work efficiently and handle all equipment and products safely
  • Cash register operations and meal ticket procedures.
  • Perform other duties during off-service hours as required.
  • Perform any reasonable request as assigned or directed by management in a suitable timeframe

About you:

  • Grade 12, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Must pass and maintain a clean criminal record
  • Possess a Food Safe level 1 certificate or provincial equivalent
  • Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbal in the English language
  • Physical ability to perform all job-related tasks
  • Ability to operate all related equipment
  • Must have excellent interpersonal skills, and organizational skills
  • Must practice good personal hygiene
  • Must be able to effectively give and receive instructions

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.


For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.

title: Sales Associate/ Customer Guide (12 Month Contract)
description:
Location

Brookfield Place - 4906 Richard Road SW

Business

As part of Brookfield Asset Management — one of the largest alternative asset managers in the world — we harness our resources to bring a fresh approach, unparalleled creativity, relentless innovation, and sound ESG practices to the planning, development, and management of buildings everywhere. From offices, retail spaces, and logistics facilities to multifamily residences, hospitality establishments, and mixed-use structures — we are reimagining real estate from the ground up.

We redefine how home and life come together for over 60 years. At Brookfield Residential, a leading North American land developer and homebuilder within the Brookfield Properties family, we have had one goal in mind – to create the best places to call home. From the development of award-winning vibrant communities to the building of well-designed homes and commercial properties, we are committed to cultivating exceptional life experiences for our customers, partners, employees, and members of the community. Learn more.

If you're ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Job Description

Your Team

As a Sales Associate/ Customer Guide (12 Month Contract), you champion the Customers for Life mindset by being a subject matter expert for your community and create personalized, memorable experiences throughout the homebuying journey. In partnership with the Community Manager you are responsible for assisting home buyers in the full customer journey and provide timely communication and updates in advance of their requests to enhance the Brookfield home buying experience.

Your journey begins by supporting your Community Manager throughout the sales home buying process, updating and maintaining administrative and operational requirements for the community and presentation centre. As well, ensuring an exceptional sales experience for our customers through point of sales presentation. You seamlessly connect with Sales and Marketing, Design, Construction, Customer Care, Purchasing, and Accounting teams as needed throughout the customer journey to ensure a quality experience for our homeowners. In addition, you are present for key milestone’s in the customer’s journey.

Your Key Deliverables

Prospecting / Sales:
Support the Community Manager in the sales process from agreement processing all the way through to transition to Customer Care.

Be well-versed in Brookfield’s product information and features to help customers in their decision-making process.

Ensuring all paperwork and appropriate follow up occurs in an efficient and timely fashion

Frequently research the respective region home market; review and compare Brookfield Residential’s products on an on-going basis

Support the Community Manager with prospecting for new business and customer opportunities and updating of CMS

Ensure that all required information for the successful executive of sales contracts is submitted timely and accurately to the appropriate departments

Oversee all documentation and paperwork load flow related to business

Provide a point of contact, establish expectations for each stage of the process and resolve customer concerns along the way.

Keep the homeowner on schedule and assist with follow up from each department.

Be fully versed in all of Brookfield’s processes.

Manage all aspects of weekly reporting in a consistent and timely manner

Update Multiple Listing Service (MLS) for your respective communities

Ensure cleanliness and quality presentation of the sales centre

Ensure lot inventory is updated on Lot Management System, Internal and external inventory maps (hard copy and digital)

Entering guest traffic and demographics in various locations and systems in a timely manner

Customer Service / Setting Expectations:
Assist the home buyers from time of contract, architectural appointments, design appointments, construction and through the close of escrow.

Supporting the end-to-end Customer Journey from entering into an agreement to closing and supporting the customer during key construction stages into the living in their new home

Represent the customer at weekly/bi-weekly community team meetings with Construction teams

Introduce homeowner to HOA team and assist in getting them oriented.

Be the central point of contact for the customer, liaising with other Brookfield team members to create a consistent and seamless customer journey

Consider special circumstances or requests from customers as needed, providing an opportunity to elevate the home buying experience in certain situations, such as offering offsite closings.

Familiarize new homeowners with their neighborhood shopping centers, banks, churches, schools, daycare centers, furniture stores, gyms, dry cleaners, restaurants, libraries, pharmacies, hospitals, hardware store, post office, movie theatres, veterinarians, interior decorator and more.

Ensure a professional atmosphere by conducting activities in a fair and equitable manner always.

Liaise with the Construction department to ensure proper information flow, orderly start and delivery of sold and spec homes

Ensure the customer is set up in the Homeowner Portal and are receiving timely updates

Properly setting accurate expectations and inoculating the customer to potential challenges that can arise.

Marketing:
Ensure that the Homes Divisions’ assets, ranging from the sales center, show homes, and spec inventory are presented professionally and marketed according to company standards

Provide input for and on innovative marketing solutions, alternative channels and points of product differentiation

Review and maintain website content for their project specifics as required

Provide feedback to marketing on traffic demographics, buyer profile and guest traffic sources

Ensure marketing material is readily available and up to date

Competitive Analysis, Industry Knowledge, & Community Awareness:

Develop and communicate a thorough and ongoing understanding of competitors’ offerings both in the new home and resale market, through regular comprehensive competitive analysis of competitor’s plans, specifications, and pricing and overall product offerings

Maintain continuous involvement within the respective Regional residential community and homebuilding industry

Obtain excellent knowledge of the city and local venues.

Familiarize new homeowners with their neighborhood shopping centers, banks, churches, schools, daycare centers, furniture stores, gyms, dry cleaners, restaurants, libraries, pharmacies, hospitals, hardware store, post office, movie theatres, veterinarians, interior decorator etc. Whenever possible, provide coupons to these local facilities

Must Haves

Post-secondary diploma or degree in Business or related area preferred, with minimum of 2 years’ experience in sales or a combination of education and experience will also be considered

Previous customer service experience with a proven successful track record.

Experience with managing multiple deliverables at the same time; detail oriented and highly organized.

Ability to deliver on performance metrics and key milestones.

Strong customer service and trouble shooting skills, and 3+ customer service related experience

Excellent conflict resolution skills

Experience within the home building or real estate industry is an asset

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products i.e. Word, Outlook, and Excel

Highly flexible with solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment

Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times

Able to work weekends

Champions of technology; open to learning and new experiences

Experience with CRM and ERP

Nice to Haves

Experience with Salesforce, Hubspot and NewStar are a plus

Your Opportunity

We are proud to offer our employees what they value most:
Competitive compensation

Health & Dental Benefits

Leadership development and mentorship programs

A culture based on our values of Passion, Integrity and Community

We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: newLaundry Aide, Part Time
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Imagine working in a place that brings out the best in you and helps others feel right at home. We provide an environment that balances independence with support. We customize our care, so that it’s right for our residents and their loved ones. A funny thing happens when we encourage our residents to engage and enjoy—we do the same. This is healthy living at its finest. Join us.

Click here for This is Marquise Hospitality video!

Job Details

Start Date: ASAP
Status: Part Time
Schedule: Every Friday and alternate weekends - 7am to 2pm
Wage: $15.42 per hour
Location: Columbia Forest LTC - 650 Mountain Maple Avenue, Waterloo ON

Job Summary

How you will make an impact:

You will be responsible for performing laundry services including cleaning and distributing linens to clients.

As a Laundry Aide, you will:

  • Properly sort, wash and dry linens following the approved laundry procedures
  • Fold, count, and stack linens following approved laundry procedures
  • Collect soiled linens along with redistributing clean linens
  • Transport supplies to include clean and soiled linen to the appropriate storage and collection areas
  • Routinely inspect linens for wear and tear, identifying worn and torn linens and following Standard Operating Procedure for damaged linens
  • Maintain the commercial and residential laundry rooms in a clean, orderly, and sanitary condition


About you:

  • Experience in housekeeping and/or laundry or equivalent combination of training and experience is an asset
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions and communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
  • Able to operate laundry equipment such as washing machines, dryers, linen press, and clothing labeler
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently or in a team setting
  • Physically able to carry out duties of the position

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.


For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.
