title: Batch Technician.CA-SCA.148 in Scarborough, Ontario | Careers at CA-ON-Scarborough-NA-Facility
description:
Overview

Integra LifeSciences is a global leader in regenerative technologies and neurosurgical solutions dedicated to limiting uncertainty for clinicians, so they can focus on providing the best patient care.

 

Founded in 1989, Integra develops, manufactures, sells and supplies best-in-class products to regenerate tissue, remove brain tumors, prevent infection and much more. And over the last three decades, we’ve evolved into one of the world’s leading global medical technology companies with more than 4,000 dedicated employees who deliver innovative medical technology solutions.

But that’s just the beginning. Integra is growing at an unprecedented rate. We’re at a moment in time where the experience you’ll gain is more robust than the experience you bring. And we’re out to invest in your future because it’s the best way to maximize ours.

 

At Integra, we firmly believe our people are our greatest asset and the foundation of our success. Our comprehensive Global Total Rewards program provides competitive compensation and benefits designed to keep our people healthy, motivated and engaged. Investing in our people through these programs is possible because of Integra’s ongoing commitment to our values and our shared success.

 

Integra’s health as a company begins with the well-being of our people. Benefit programs vary by country, whether provided through company-sponsored insurance and programs, through statutory government programs, or a combination of both.

 

Regardless of geographic location, our commitment is to offer the following, whenever possible:

  • Benefit plans that meet all local statutory requirements
  • A range of programs that reflect typical local market practices
  • An opportunity for employees to tailor benefits to their specific needs
  • Benefits that balance employee’s short-term and long-term needs

Click HERE for more information regarding our benefits and total rewards program

Responsibilities

  • Operate and maintain machines/equipment in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures
  • Organize staff with instructions from Supervisor based on schedule requirements
  • Confirm and verify product code(s), lot number(s) and quantities for production run based on the production schedule
  • Check and verify that the correct raw materials and packaging materials for the type of product manufactured supplied based on the Bill of Materials/Work Order
  • Coordinate product/mixing schedule with Production Supervisor and if necessary with Planner to achieve work order completion
  • As Applicable: Assign and record expiry date for products that require expiry date
  • Perform line clearances, ensuring that all materials from previous production run are removed and that only the correct materials for the current production run is present
  • Set up and adjust equipment settings according to the type of product to be manufactured, based on the Bill of Materials/Work Order
  • Manufacture/Pack the product according to product specification and in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures
  • Perform regular inspection on the quality of the product, pack finished product in the boxes and complete the inspection report as well as in process testing of boots

·        As Applicable: Ensure that each box is clearly marked with the correct lot/expiry date and correct labels placed on each

  • Check, confirm and record total quantity of products manufactured on Production Report
  • Submit all paperwork, bill of material/work order and inspection report to Supervisor

·        Clean, sanitize and maintain equipment in proper working condition

  • Troubleshoot problem during the operation and carry-out routine adjustments to ensure the operation is efficient as required
  • Assist with the training of new Assemblers
  • Meet daily production targets as scheduled
  • Run overtime shifts if required with approval
  • Performs additional related duties as required

 

 

·        Perform duties in a safe and timely manner, observing Good Manufacturing Practices at all times

·        Monitor production, safety and housekeeping of the Shift

·        Actively participate in Safety programs, trainings and initiative

·        Actively participate in Daily operations and KPI reviews

·        Helps in monitoring line efficiency and performance of machines. Suggest improvements to hit scheduled targets

·         

Qualifications

DESIRED MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Completed Secondary Education
  • Machine operation, mixing or compounding experience an asset
  • Can communicate effectively both verbal and written
  • Have mechanical aptitude

 

TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT USED

 

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical requirements listed in this section include, but are not limited, to the motor/physical abilities and skills require of this position in order to successfully undertake the essential duties and responsibilities of this position. In accordance with the Canadians with Disabilities Act (ADA), reasonable accommodations may be made to empower individuals with disabilities to undertake the essential duties and responsibilities of the position.

 

While undertaking the essential duties and responsibilities of the position, the employee must repeatedly

sit, listen, and speak.  The employee is required to go to all areas of the company. The employee may be required to periodically lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

 

ADVERSE WORKING CONDITIONS

The adverse working conditions listed in this section include, but are not limited to, those environmental conditions to which the employee may be exposed while undertaking the essential duties and responsibilities of this position, which is that of a general plant environment.

 

In an effort to minimize the spread of the coronavirus and to protect our employees, all new hires in the US and Puerto Rico will need to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 in order to be considered for employment with Integra LifeSciences, unless eligible for an accommodation as provided by law.

title: Patient Care Assistant (Southwestern Ontario) - Medical Office Administration
description:
Are you looking for a career in health care administration? You’re looking in the right place.

What will you do?

The Patient Care Assistant plays a key role in supporting patients throughout all stages of their healthcare journey. As a Patient Care Assistant, you will triage important information to the Care Coordinator, and offer “real-time” solutions to patients, where appropriate. The Patient Care Assistant frequently interacts with various stakeholders by telephone and other communication methods, whether answering incoming questions or providing health care system navigation.

The Patient Care Assistant provides timely follow up on patient issues, and is responsible for ensuring accurate documentation in our patient databases. To support the Care Coordinator, the Patient Care Assistant also helps with managing a variety of tasks relevant to the Care Coordinator’s specific caseload.

Currently operating in a hybrid “work-from-home” model (i.e., some work to be completed from a HCCSS South West office location and some work may be completed from a home office), you will have the opportunity to impact lives in your community, enjoy a balanced lifestyle, and be part of a great team that makes care happen.

What must you have?

  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Certificate or Diploma in health care administration is an asset.
  • Minimum one (1) year of related experience, preferably in health care/medical administration or services.
  • Working knowledge of Medical Terminology.
  • Efficient computer literacy in patient health databases and Windows environment.
  • Proven team collaborator with excellent communication and conflict resolution skills.
  • Ability to prioritize competing requests and function well under pressure.
  • Consistently adheres to privacy legislation and confidentiality standards.
  • Flexible work schedule (i.e., days, evenings, and weekends) to meet organizational needs.

What would give you an advantage?

  • Proficiency in a second language, particularly French.
  • Experience working with people from diverse socioeconomic and cultural backgrounds.
  • An ambassador of respectful and inclusive workplace culture.

Who we are:

Home and Community Care Support Services South Westis one of 14 Home and Community Care Support Services organizations in Ontario with a focused mandate to deliver local health care services such as home and community care and long-term care home placement. These organizations were previously known as Local Health Integration Networks at a time when they also led local health care planning and funding, and those functions are now part of Ontario Health. Learn more atwww.healthcareathome.ca/southwest.

Our organization is a recipient of the 2019 Canada’s Healthy Workplace Month Great Employers Award, making it a recognized organization in supporting employee health and safety. 

How do I apply?

Please visit www.HealthCareAtHome.ca to submit your resume and cover letter. Application deadline is 1 May 2022 at 23:59 hours.

Please ensure your cover letter clearly identifies the following:

  • Locations at which you are willing and able to work (i.e., Woodstock, St Thomas, London, Stratford, or Owen Sound).

We are committed to a culture that values diversity and inclusion.We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, and are committed to providing accommodation as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process.

Home and Community Care Support Services values the health and safety of its employees and is committed to the prevention of COVID-19 exposure and transmission of infection to employees, patients, caregivers, volunteers, visitors and residents. As a requirement of Home and Community Care Support Services’ Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all employees must be considered fully vaccinated for COVID-19.

title: Healthcare Assistant
description:
Company Description

£12- £13.50 per hour.

Home Instead is the world’s leading provider of non-medical care and companionship services for older people. With minimum visits of one hour, award winning training and an excellent reputation we are immensely proud of the quality of care we provide. We match oou Care Professionals to our clients based on mutual interests and hobbies to help build bonds of trust and enables us to provide personalised support.  

Job Description

Do you have concerns about being able to keep on top of paying your bills in these uncertain times?

Have you always thought that a job in care can’t possibly pay the bills?

Home Instead Salisbury and Romsey have recently been awarded the Living Wage Employer status, and we are the only care company in Salisbury that hold this. So, with the cost of living on the increase, you can be safe in the knowledge that you will still be able to pay your bills.

We are a companionship-led care company covering the Salisbury and Romsey area. We devote at least an hour to every client you visit, which means that rather than rushing to get tasks done, you can spend meaningful time with your clients and make a real difference to their lives. We also pride ourselves on keeping our clients’ care teams as small and consistent as possible so that they have the continuity they crave.

You will receive excellent support and award-winning training, so no experience is necessary. What is essential is that you are kind, caring, compassionate and really want to make a difference to someone’s life.

Qualifications

No formal qualifications are required, as you will receive full in house training. All we look for is a genuine caring nature.



Additional Information

As a Care Professional, you will receive industry leading training, great rates of pay and excellent support.

If you're looking for work which is extremely rewarding and satisfactory and have a high-degree of  flexibility to meet our clients' needs, we would love to hear from you. Please click on 'I'm Interested' or alternatively, contact us on 01722 443559

We encourage applications from all sections of the community as we want to reflect the neighbourhoods in which we work. Home Instead is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of adults and expects all staff to share this commitment. This role is subject to DBS enhanced disclosure.

title: You will:
description:
Clio is one of the fastest-growing technology startups in Canada consistently included in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 rankings. We are expanding quickly and seeking a Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead our Product Marketing campaigns and optimize synergies with the Product Management and Sales Teams. As a bonus, you’ll be working out of our award-winning Burnaby Headquarters.

If you want a high impact leadership role, we want to talk to you! Very few companies have our breadth of projects, and they will be meaningful. You will be a rockstar between all departments, have free reign, work directly with the Executives, and be in one of the highest impact roles in the company.

Clio is a cloud-based practice management solution for lawyers that makes their lives simpler and helps them build a better practice. Users love us and it's your mission to leave the competition in the dust. To learn more, visit teamclio.tumblr.com

title: Health Care Aide- Holy Cross Manor
description:
Job Description:

This is a temporary position ending on or before October 30, 2022.

 

Being a part of Covenant Care/Covenant Living means being a part of an organization that takes its mission to heart in everything we do. We draw on being rooted in a Catholic tradition that has been serving Albertans for over 155 years. We believe that this is what makes our organization stand out in our approach.

Our mission is to â€œcontinue the healing ministry of Jesus by serving with compassion, upholding the sacredness of life in all stages, and caring for the whole person â€“ body, mind and soul.â€

All Employees are called to our mission through their desire to serve, support transformation and growth, and contribute to the betterment of all those we serve, as well as each other.

Our Employees are an extension of our residentâ€™s families and key to how they feel about their home. As a valued member of the Covenant family, you have the ability and desire to be a part of influencing the lives of all those that reside in our home sites and contribute to a caring and compassionate environment.

If this description of our organization resonates with you, and you are called to serve, please see the below outlined career opportunity, and how you can contribute to our organization.

 

Qualifications

  • Minimum Grade 12 required
  • Completed recognized Health Care Aide Certificate (or equivalent recognized training/experience)
  • Proof of enrollment in Alberta Health Care Aide Directory
  • 1 year of experience in a supportive living  facility preferred
  • Ability to speak, read and write English fluently
  • Computer skills an asset
  • Other attributes, including: compassion, empathy, respect, problem solving, accountability, insight, teamwork
  • Required proof of completion of vaccination
When Applying:

Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
All employees new to Covenant Care must provide a criminal records check, including vulnerable sector search.
Covenant Care is committed to an inclusive work environment and encourages all qualified  individuals to apply.

We thank you in advance for applying with Covenant Care.

title: Healthcare Aides/Caregivers - Homecare - Red Deer and Area
description:
Do you want to make lives better and have the ability to drive your career? Do you love working with seniors? Nurse Next Door has the perfect opportunity for you!

Nurse Next Door is dedicated to delivering flexible, premium care options to help seniors stay at home, because we know home is the safest place to be.

Do you want a flexible work schedule that fits with the other priorities in your life? Nurse Next Door is looking for Caregivers who are able to work 10 to 40 hours per week (no experience required)! We have flexible hours in the morning, afternoon, evenings, and overnights.

We Make Lives Better every day for our team members through our People Promise.

What we offer: 

  • Competitive wages and comprehensive compensation packages
  • 24/7 support center to assist with scheduling related questions
  • 24/7 assistance related to your client’s care

Responsibilities and Duties: 

  • Provide meal preparation, light housekeeping, and/or provide companionship and personal care.

  • Happier Aging is at the heart of what we do — enabling seniors to live at home as long as possible, doing what they love to do. 

  • Execute on the client’s care plan as outlined by the Care Designer.

  • Help clients with their ADL's (Activities of Daily Living) that is within the scope of practice for a Registered Health Care Aide.

  • Assist clients with transfers, ambulation and exercises.

  • Meet the safety needs of the client and use equipment safely and properly.

  • Function within the limits of your own experience and knowledge, while practicing safely and competently within the job description.

  • Complete records and documentation accurately and thoroughly.

Requirements: 

  • Previous caregiving experience is an asset.

  • Ability to identify and report client care concerns to Care Designers when needed.

  • Must be able to speak and write in English. Other languages will be an asset.

  • Background or Criminal Record Check with a Vulnerable Sector Search less than 1 year old (updated every 5 years for continued employment)

  • Negative TB test less than 1 year old  (updated every 5 years for continued employment)

Learn more here:  https://www.nursenextdoor.com/jobs

title: Health Care Aide (HCA-CC00-039)
description:
About Bethany

For 75 years, Bethany has been improving the lives of Alberta seniors and adults with disabilities by providing housing, health and community services that honour their spirit and individuality. 

Why Bethany?

We are looking for individuals who want to feel connected to their community in a person-centered organization. Bethany has consecutively won Top Employer, 13 years in a row for the programs we invest in for our employees. 

Bethany offers top-up for parental leaves, generous vacation and leave time, competitive salaries, benefits and retirement savings programs. We are committed to employee well-being and giving back to our community. We invest in our people because they are the reason for our success.

For more information, check out this video about Working at Bethany

About the Role

With a passion for care towards residents, families and team members, the Health Care Aide is accountable for providing outstanding care and support to residents, resident families and volunteers within their designated scope of practice. The Health Care Aide demonstrates responsiveness to the holistic needs of residents by assisting with activities of daily living, promoting choices, maintaining dignity and facilitating resident independence.

 What You Will Do
 Individual responsibilities will fall under five main areas of focus:

  1. Resident-Centered Care: Promotes service excellence and is responsive to the residents’ needs in accordance with resident care plans, policies and procedures. Assists residents with all activities of daily living as required, while maintaining the resident’s privacy and dignity.
  2. Documentation: Accurately and comprehensively documents and reports care and related observations to the Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse in a timely manner. Monitors, observes and documents residents’ holistic needs in the health care record, including the physical, psychological, spiritual, social and emotional well-being of the resident.
  3. Safety: Contributes to a safe environment for residents, the team and self by understanding and adhering to safety guidelines and practices at all times. Demonstrates thorough knowledge of all resident, occupational health and safety and emergency preparedness and response policies and procedures.
  4. Pro-active Learner: Demonstrates the vision and values of Bethany and lives out the mission of Creating Caring Communities.
  5. Team Work: Cares for and works cooperatively with others as an effective team member. Participates with other interdisciplinary team members in evaluating and changing the documented care needs of residents.

What You Bring

  • Grade 10 education and Government of Alberta approved Health Care Aide certificate
  • Registered with the Government of Alberta Health Care Aide Directory
  • Previous Health Care Aide experience is preferred but not required
  • Ability to work effectively in a physically and mentally demanding environment
  • Demonstrates ability to understand, speak, read and write effectively in English
  • Excellent observation, communication and problem solving skills


Position Information:

  • Posting Number: 20-5421
  • Position Number: HCA-CC00-039
  • Closing Date: May 15, 2022
  • Location: Bethany Cochrane
  • Union: AUPE
  • Unit:: Care Services
  • FTE: 0.40
  • Position Type: Part Time
  • Shift: Evenings (16:30-21:30)
  • Hours of Work/Shift Per Cycle: 14 evening shifts in a 4 week rotation

 How to Apply:

Like what you see and think you have what it takes to join our team?  Apply Online at: http://bethanyseniors.com/careers/ Please note this competition may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found

 All applicants are thanked for their interest.

Bethany Care Society is an equal opportunity employer.

Successful candidates will be required to obtain a Criminal Background Check & provide proof of all mandatory immunizations..

Bethany Care Society complies with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). By forwarding your resume to Bethany you are consenting to the collection and use of your personal information for this job competition. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.

title: Health Care Aide
description:
Description:

The Heart Investigation Unit serves the Central-South region of Ontario and comprises 4 cardiac catheterization labs and a 32 bed reception/recovery area. The interdisciplinary team comprises cardiologists, radiologists, critical care nurses, HIU technicians and medical radiation technologists. Interventions include left and right heart catheterizations and interventional procedures such as PTCAs and stents.



Qualifications:

The Heart Investigation Unit serves the Central-South region of Ontario and comprises 4 cardiac catheterization labs and a 32 bed reception/recovery area. The interdisciplinary team comprises cardiologists, radiologists, critical care nurses, HIU technicians and medical radiation technologists. Interventions include left and right heart catheterizations and interventional procedures such as PTCAs and stents.


As a member of the healthcare team, the HCA supports patient care through equipment and supply management, maintenance of a clean, safe environment and the portering of charts, equipment, specimens, etc. The HCA provides unit support to patients, families and those providing service and/or care.

2. Completed CSAO Techniques course

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Operations at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:

Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement

Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement

Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement

Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement

Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement

title: Infirmière auxiliaire
description:
Établissement : FIRME BROUILLETTE INC.

Titre d'emploi : INFIRMIER(E) AUXILIAIRE

Direction : Responsable des ressources humaines

Ville de l'emploi : Rock Forrest


Type de poste : Personnel non-syndiqué

Statut de l’emploi : Permanent / Long terme - temps partiel


Quart de travail : 8h à 16h - 1 fin de semaine sur 2

Échelle salariale : 33 $ / heure


Vous voulez de nouveaux challenges et de meilleures conditions salariales ?


Firme Brouillette est spécialisée dans le recrutement de personnel de santé et offre des contrats de courtes, moyennes et longues durées partout dans les territoires Québécois et certain territoires Canadien.


En venant travailler pour notre agence, vous reprendrez contrôle sur votre flexibilité d'horaire et de lieu de travail en aillant l'opportunité de choisir parmi nos nombreuses offres d'emploi.


Venez évoluer au sein d'une entreprise humaine qui recherche des candidats Fiables, Innovateurs, Responsables, Motivés et Engagés.Nous travaillons dans votre intérêt afin de créer des conditions de travail agréables, stimulantes et enrichissantes qui vous permettront d'améliorer votre qualité de vie.


Osez une nouvelle aventure professionnelle !!



Aptitudes requises:

- Connaissances liées à la clientèle, à l'organisation et au poste

- Travail d'équipe

- Leadership mobilisateur

- Influence en groupe

- Communication interpersonnelle

- Analyse et résolution de problèmes

- Organisation

- Esprit de synthèse

- Introspection

- Fait preuve d'initiative


Remarques : Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui postulent mais devons les aviser que seules celles dont la candidature est retenue seront contactées.




Détenir le DEP Santé, assistance et soins infirmiers

Être membre de l’Ordre des Infirmières et Infirmiers auxiliaires du Québec (OIIAQ)

title: Health Care Aide (Homecare)
description:
Health Care Aide - Grande Prairie

Do you want to make lives better and have the ability to drive your career? Do you love working with seniors? Nurse Next Door has the perfect opportunity for you!

Nurse Next Door is dedicated to delivering flexible, premium care options to help seniors stay at home, because we know home is the safest place to be.

Do you want a flexible work schedule that fits with the other priorities in your life? Nurse Next Door is looking for Caregivers who are able to work 9 hours per week (no experience required)! We have flexible hours in the morning, afternoon, evenings, and overnights.

We Make Lives Better every day for our team members through our People Promise.

What we offer: 

  • Competitive wages and comprehensive compensation packages
    • Referral bonuses for referring A-players
  • 24/7 support center to assist with scheduling related questions
  • 24/7 assistance related to your client’s care

Responsibilities and Duties: 

  • Provide meal preparation, light housekeeping, and/or provide companionship and personal care.
  • Happier Aging is at the heart of what we do — enabling seniors to live at home as long as possible, doing what they love to do. 
  • Execute on the client’s care plan as outlined by the Care Designer.
  • Help clients with their ADL's (Activities of Daily Living) that is within the scope of practice for a Registered Health Care Aide.
  • Assist clients with transfers, ambulation and exercises.
  • Meet the safety needs of the client and use equipment safely and properly.
  • Function within the limits of your own experience and knowledge, while practicing safely and competently within the job description.
  • Complete records and documentation accurately and thoroughly.
  • Role would be mainly companionship, doing activities with clients and accompanying client on outings. 
  • Flexible visits , minimum 9 hours per week

Requirements: 

  • Previous caregiving experience is an asset.
  • Ability to identify and report client care concerns to Care Designers when needed.
  • Must be able to speak and write in English. Other languages will be an asset.
  • Background or Criminal Record Check with a Vulnerable Sector Search (updated every 5 years for continued employment)
  • Negative TB test (updated every 5 years for continued employment)

Learn more here:  https://www.nursenextdoor.com/jobs

title: CERTIFIED HEALTH CARE AIDE – Extendicare Sunset
description:
CERTIFIED HEALTH CARE AIDE (Casual) – Extendicare Sunset

 

Candidates are invited to apply for the above position to work at our Sunset Home located in Regina, Saskatchewan.

 

Under the direction of the Registered Nurse and the Licensed Practical Nurse,the Health Care Aide provides direct personal and nursing care to resident to fulfill the physical, intellectual, emotional, social and spiritual needs of residents and in accordance with the home’s policies, procedures and work routines. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assists in providing restorative care for residents; assists with ambulation, feeding, bathing and grooming.
  • Consults with and informs team leader of activities, needs and problems related to resident care. Utilizes observation skills to note changes in resident’s condition. Keeps team members informed of observations through Point of Care Charting
  • Encourages participation in activity programs by assisting residents to prepare for and assisting them to and from activities.
  • Assists with admission, discharge and transfer of residents.
  • Assists with meal service and nourishment delivery to residents and provides feeding assistance as required. Reports any changes in appetite to RN/LPN.
  • Provides emotional and social support to residents/families including palliative care.
  • Adheres to established department policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, fire, safety, environment and infection control. 

QUALIFICATIONS:  

  • Ability to read and write English as well as to understand verbal and written instructions in English.
  • Health Care Aide certification.
  • Long Term Care experience preferred.
  • Regular lifting and moving residents, equipment and supplies. Repeated lifting, squatting, reaching and bending.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrates organizational skills and ability to complete assignments in a timely manner.

Closing Date: May 20, 2022

Only those candidates chosen for an interview will be contacted. Interested candidates may forward their resume to the following:

 

Dick Cornish, Administrator

Email: RCornish@extendicare.com

 

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Infirmier(ère) auxiliaire
description:
Œuvrant dans le domaine des résidences pour personnes aînées, la nouvelle résidence de Lokia, Le Domaine Mahonia a comme mission doffrir une qualité de vie supérieure dans un milieu chaleureux, respectueux et stimulant tout en maintenant l’autonomie. Le Domaine Mahonia comptera héberger des personnes autonomes et en pertes dautonomie, et ce, dès Juin 2022.

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de candidatures pour pourvoir à des postes dinfirmier(ère) auxiliaire.

Si vous savez apporter sourire et compréhension aux personnes aînées, vous serez heureux dans notre milieu de vie.

ON DIT DE VOUS QUE VOUS ÊTES:

  • Une personne respectueuse et que vous aimez travailler avec les personnes aînées;
  • Sociable et que le travail déquipe est important pour vous;
  • À lécoute des besoins des aînés et vous avez à cœur de respecter leurs attentes;
  • Reconnu pour être positif et capable de développer facilement des liens.

VOS TALENTS ET COMPÉTENCES VOUS PERMETTENT:

  • De soigner les plaies, faire les pansements et prodiguer les soins nécessaires aux résidents;
  • De se préoccuper de l’état de santé des résidents et de réaliser les gestes techniques nécessaires, en veillant au bien-être physique et moral;
  • De superviser les préposés(es) aux bénéficiaires lors de l’administration des médicaments et des actes délégués, la prise de tension, glycémie, insuline, etc.;
  • De s’assurer du support technique et moral à l’équipe des soins de la résidence et apporter l’encadrement nécessaire afin que nos résidents reçoivent une qualité de soins et services de grande qualité;
  • De surveiller l’hygiène et l’équilibre alimentaire des résidents et recueillir les données nécessaires au suivi de son état de santé (température, pulsations, pression artérielle, etc.);
  • Dassurer une présence humaine auprès des résidents qui en éprouvent le besoin afin de les aider, les encourager et leur donner le soutien moral qu’ils ont besoin;
  • De préparer et s’assurer que les fiches de soins des résidents soient mises à jour de façon quotidienne;
  • De gérer les urgences qui peuvent se produire;
  • Etc.

VOUS DÉTENEZ LUNE DES FORMATIONS SUIVANTES:

  • Formation en soins infirmiers (DEP);
  • RCR
  • Permis de lOIIAQ
  • Connaissance du logiciel SyMO (un atout).

*Les formations en cours seront également considérées.

VOICI CE QUE NOUS NOUS ENGAGEONS À VOUS OFFRIR:

  • Un environnement où le personnel est au cœur de nos préoccupations;
  • Lencadrement nécessaire pour développer vos compétences
  • Une belle ambiance de travail avec une équipe dynamique et de bonnes valeurs
  • Prime de soir 0.50$ , de nuit 1.00$
  • Prime de référencement de 500$
  • Prime du gouvernement en vigueur
  • Une sécurité d’emploi
  • Une compensation financière pour l’achat d’uniforme;
  • Des activités sociales organisées par lentreprise;
  • Et encore plus.

HORAIRE DE TRAVAIL:

  • Postes à temps plein jour ou soir ou nuit 40h;
  • Une fin de semaine sur deux

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons quavec les personnes dont la candidature est retenue pour une entrevue.

#maho2022


Santé et soins infirmiers

title: Health Care Aide - Casual - West Vancouver, BC
description:
Care to join us? 

If you are a caring and skilled individual who enjoys working with seniors, we want to hear from you! 

We are looking for a casual Assisted Living Worker to work at Kiwanis Manor, our Assisted Living  senior care community in West Vancouver, BC.

Benefits of working for Vantage Living:

  • Extended benefits. 100% Employer funded benefit plan available for full and part-time staff who work more than 20 hours/week.
  • Work/life balance. Flexible schedules to support your work-life balance.
  • Local. Locally owned and operated, supporting the community.
  • Modern. Beautiful, modern communities that inspire lifestyle.
  • Weâ€™re cool. A fun and vibrant company culture!

Responsibilities of the position:

  • Be human. Respect and promote the dignity, choices, and individuality of each client.
  • Be personable. Recognize clients as individuals with unique cultural, spiritual, and psychosocial needs.
  • Be respectful. Respond to scheduled and unscheduled requests from clients for assistance with bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, mobility, and treatments at times that respect client choice (as outlined in the Care Plan).
  • Be diligent. Report critical incidents and unusual occurrences to the Program Coordinator.
  • Be an opportunist with a dash of spontaneity. Participate in the delivery of social, recreational and therapeutic programs such as group activities, outings, special events, communal impromptu gatherings, and the coordination of spontaneous opportunities for being social.
  • Be ambitious. Take initiative in organizing unscheduled social and recreational opportunities wherever possible (i.e. card games, movies, gardening, etc.).
  • Be attentive. Performs other duties as assigned.

Your desired experience and expertise:

  • Graduate of Health Care Aide program.
  • Registered with the BC Care Aide Registry.
  • WHMIS certificate
  • Passionate about and skilled in delivering personal care services and activities that respond to the needs, functional ability, interests, and choices of clients.

Status: Casual

We thank all applicants for their interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Residential Care Attendant
description:
Canadian Health Labs (CHL) is a mobile healthcare provider under contract to provide assistance and support for long-term care organization with various public and private sector organizations throughout Canada.

This is an opportunity to contribute to keeping Canadians safe and healthy. You will be working in a team environment with other healthcare and allied professionals with the unique role of Residential Care Attendants to fulfill staffing needs in various public & private long-term care settings throughout Newfoundland Labrador.

We are looking for individuals who can travel/deploy for a minimum of 60-days (or longer). Travel & accommodation costs are covered by the employer. Evening and Weekend availability required. Travel between the locations within Newfoundland and Labrador will be required

Required Skills/Abilities:

  • Demonstrated skills in leadership, communication, teamwork, concern resolution process and customer service
  • Ability to work under supervision as well as independently and part of a team.
  • Strong organizational and computer skills are required in this position.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and commitment to person-centered care
  • Ability to problem solve through critical thinking and self-education.
  • Enthusiastic attitude and energy to provide excellent care and the ability to show demonstrate patience, sensitivity, and creativity
  • Ability to work on his/her feet for a complete shift
  • Awareness of accident and injury prevention, hazard identification and control; Adherence to safe work practices and procedures is essential in
  • Physically and mentally fit to perform the duties of the position (may be required to lift, move, push, or pull objects weighing up to 20 kilograms).

Education and Experience:

  • Successful completion of a recognized Resident Care Attendant training program or equivalent.
  • Experience should include working with community health care agencies and private health care providers
  • Ability to show demonstrated patience, sensitivity, and creativity.
  • A combination of training, education, and experience that is equivalent to the employment standard listed above and that provides the required knowledge and abilities.

The successful applicant must provide satisfactory criminal records  and Vulnerable Record Check prior to beginning employment. Provide proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required as per provincial health authority COVID-19 vaccination policy.

Compensation:

Is based on experience and qualifications.

title: Health Care Aide
description:
Are you a people person with a strong desire to make others happy? Comfort Keepers wants you to join our team of compassionate in-home caregivers.

Comfort Keepers is looking for a Health Care Aide (HCA) in the Vancouver, BC area to join our growing team. We are a leading in-home care provider for seniors and other adults that require a helping hand or companionship in their home.

In this position, you will provide non-medical, in-home support and home management services. Join a growing family dedicated to providing companionship, personal care and other health care needs for seniors in their own homes. Both part and full-time positions available. Our Personal Support Workers provide exceptional in-home and companion experiences and assist with services detailed in our customized personal care service plans.

Only registered health care aides or international nurses will be considered for the position. Registered HCAs are eligible for higher incentives!

Comfort Keepers offers the following benefits:

  • Competitive Pay â€“ Including direct deposit and holiday pay
  • Paid Training â€“ foster growth and development through paid web-based and in-person training
  • Friendly Environment â€“ 24-hour support available, a fun team-centric atmosphere
  • Companionship & Friendship â€“ Create lasting relationships with seniors and their loved ones
  • Reimbursement â€“ Get repaid for client related transportation
  • Flexibility â€“ flexible start dates, ability to work near your home

Take the first step toward an exciting career with Comfort Keepers! Apply Today!

Job Requirements:

  • Driver's License
  • Genuinely concerned about helping people
  • Access to a mobile phone (data-enabled preferred) and internet
  • Reliable transportation
  • HCA Certificate 
  • Current First Aid and CPR Training
  • Available to work weekends and some overnight shifts is a bonus!

Apply Today!

Our office serves seniors in Vancouver and surrounding communities, including Abbotsford, Burnaby, Langley, Maple Ridge, Surrey & White Rock. This position may require travel to those areas â€“ we do our best to match you with clients in your area.

title: Registered Health Care Aide
description:
Are you a Registered Health Care Aide looking to make a difference in the lives of others? We are currently looking to add to our growing home care team. 

What we offer:

  • A safe working environment for you while you provide care to your clients in their own homes
  • An expedited hiring process to get you working as soon as possible
  • Ongoing free training and education
  • Rewards for career milestones
  • A wonderful team of nurses and coordinators to support you throughout your employment
  • Referral bonuses
  • A variety of shifts that will work with your schedule, whether you are available days, evenings, or weekends

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Experience working as a HCA
  • Valid HCA registration in BC
  • The ability to complete basic documentation via smart phone
  • Positive and friendly attitude
  • Valid CPR certificate
  • Clean criminal record check (required)
  • Valid driver's license and vehicle (required) 

As an HCA with Classic, your duties will include but not be limited to:

  • Assistance with personal care 
  • Assistance with medications
  • Light meal preparation
  • Housekeeping
  • Companionship 

Classic LifeCare is a family-run home care agency that has been providing the finest home healthcare experience for the past 45 years. We are accredited by Accreditation Canada.

If you would like to join our team, submit your application and you can expect our call very soon!

title: Registered Health Care Aide
description:
Are you a Registered Health Care Aide looking to make a difference in the lives of others? We are currently looking to add to our growing home care team. 

What we offer:

  • A safe working environment for you while you provide care to your clients in their own homes
  • An expedited hiring process to get you working as soon as possible
  • Ongoing free training and education
  • Rewards for career milestones
  • A wonderful team of nurses and coordinators to support you throughout your employment
  • Referral bonuses
  • A variety of shifts that will work with your schedule, whether you are available days, evenings, or weekends

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Experience working as a HCA
  • Valid HCA registration in BC
  • The ability to complete basic documentation via smart phone
  • Positive and friendly attitude
  • Valid CPR certificate
  • Clean criminal record check (required)
  • Valid driver's license and vehicle (required) 

As an HCA with Classic, your duties will include but not be limited to:

  • Assistance with personal care 
  • Assistance with medications
  • Light meal preparation
  • Housekeeping
  • Companionship 

Classic LifeCare is a family-run home care agency that has been providing the finest home healthcare experience for the past 45 years. We are accredited by Accreditation Canada.

If you would like to join our team, submit your application and you can expect our call very soon!

We hire people who are passionate about helping others, who want to make a difference with their time, and who can bring their authentic selves to work. All are welcome at Classic LifeCare.

title: Resident and Guest Attendant (Health Care Aide)
description:
It's an amazing time to join Golden Life as we continue to expand our seniors housing, care, and services within western Canada.

We’re looking for a qualified, full-time nightResident and Guest Attendantto join our Village team in Cochrane, AB. If you are a registered Health Care Aide and a strong team player, then we’d like to hear from you!

The successful candidate will have related experience and has a passion for providing high quality care and support for seniors.

We're looking for someone who:
  • Delivers personal care and homemaking services in a flexible manner according to the needs of the residents.
  • Follows the residents Care plan and completed required documentation.
  • Participates in the organization and delivery of social and recreational program and activities.
  • Assists with meal preparation and service in the dining room and tray service to resident suites when necessary.
  • Reports changes in functional capacity, mood or health status to the Community Manager or designate.
  • Actively participates in resident care review meetings.
  • Provides housekeeping and laundry services including cleaning of public areas.
  • Performs administrative tasks as assigned.
  • Participates in program planning and evaluation, and in Quality Improvement.
  • Fosters a warm, friendly and caring environment for residents and co-workers.
  • Has a passion for helping seniors live their best life.
  • Possesses a Certificate from a recognized Health Care Aide Program.
  • Is a registered Health Care Aide in Alberta.
  • Clear Criminal Record Check – Vulnerable Sector.
  • Has a Physician’s waiver and complete Immunization record.
  • Capable of work which involves extended periods of walking and standing.
Our culture attracts proactive self-starters who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion, integrity, passion, and curiosity. If this resonates, maybe you’re the right person to join the Golden Life team.

What we offer you

At Golden Life Management Corporation, we are purpose-led. Our Philosophy is focused entirely upon providing the best possible quality of care to our residents and those we serve. We recognize that engaged employees are necessary to achieve our purpose and our Philosophy.

As a Golden Life Team member, you can expect to be treated with dignity and respect, to be challenged with your work, and to have the autonomy necessary to excel. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a voluntary retirement program with company contributions, for eligible employees.

If this sound attractive to you, please apply today!

title: Infirmier(ère) auxiliaire
description:
Envie d’autres choses ?


Létoile Services en Santé vous offre une expérience de travail unique et adaptée à vos besoins. Joignez-vous à une équipe qui a une forte rétention de son personnel et qui se distingue dans le domaine de la santé.

Nous sommes fiers dêtre une entreprise de choix, vous offrant une qualité de vie et le respect. Découvrez notretaux horaire élevé, mais surtout, retrouver le plaisir d’une vocation !

L’étoile Services en Santé offre ses services dans plusieurs établissements du Réseau de la santé, tels que les CHSLD, les CLSC, ainsi que les centres hospitaliers. Nous sommes à la recherche de candidats pour occuper des postes d’infirmières et d’infirmiers auxiliaires afin de combler un besoin URGENT.

Taux horaire : $24 et plus/heure

Avantages :
  • Taux horaire élevé
  • Choisissez lhoraire qui vous convient
  • Application mobile pour vos horaires et pour tout autre renseignement utile
  • REER collectif
  • Fiers membres de lEPPSQ, association regroupant les fournisseurs officiels du réseau de la santé
  • Des expériences de travail diversifiées
  • Support et encadrement assurés par une équipe professionnelle et dynamique à l’écoute de vos besoins

Disponibilités :
  • Temps plein
  • Temps partiel
  • Jour
  • Soir
  • Nuit

Description des tâches :
Vous aurez notamment à répondre à l’état de santé des patients, dispenser les soins de base, surveiller le progrès des patients, informer l’équipe soignante et mettre à jour le dossier de chaque patient sur les observations réalisées.

Exigences :
  • Être membre en règle de lOIIAQ
  • Une expérience pertinente de minimum 6 mois (un atout)
  • Formation PCI obligatoire. Veuillez vous référer à ladresse suivant pour suivre la formation:  

Pour plus de renseignements, envoyez-nous un courriel au

Découvrez-nous sur notre site WEB :

Bienvenue aux 50 ans et plus :

Membre de l'ordre Adéquatement vacciné

title: Health Care Aide / Residential Care
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

"It makes me feel good knowing that we make the residents’ lives better. We laugh with them, cry with them, sing and dance with them – we brighten their day. Working here is an unbelievable privilege and it will be something I carry with me for the rest of my life!"- Sunrise Team Member 

 

At Sunrise, our Care Manager is responsible for providing the highest degree of quality care and services to a consistent group of residents and their families in our assisted living and reminiscence neighborhoods.

ABOUT SUNRISE

Sunrise Senior Living has championed quality of life in senior care for more than 30 years. We believe team members are our greatest resource and are looking for people who share our commitment to provide quality care for seniors and their families. It's no surprise that many of the world's leading experts in Senior Living entrust their career to Sunrise. At Sunrise, you will…Make a Difference Every DayWe are passionate about our mission — to champion quality of life for all seniors. We deliver high-quality care with a personal touch and encourage our residents to enjoy life to the fullest. 

 

Be Part of a Uniquely Supportive CommunityThe care-focused environment we create for residents extends to our team members. We offer programs, rewards, and benefits to help you live your best. 

 

Ignite Your PotentialWe believe potential has no limits. We offer best-in-class leadership development programs designed to grow our leaders. We are committed to helping our team members achieve their career goals. Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work®

RESPONSIBILITIES & QUALIFICATIONS

 Position 1  :   Temp Full Time Tuesday to Saturday (2pm to 10pm)  Position 2  : Temporary Full TimeFriday & Saturday (6am to 2pm)Sunday & Monday (2pm to 10pm) Position 3 : Permanent Full TimeSunday to Thursday (6am to 2pm)       Also Available : On Call Position   Responsibilities:- Build meaningful relationships with a specified number of seniors and their families as you provide assistance with activities of daily living, attend to individual care needs and get to know their unique preferences and personalities- Notify management of changes in condition and recommend adjustments in the level of care and service- Assist residents in life skills and other life enriching activities as indicated on their individual profile- Blends a variety of multi-sensory experiences into the resident's day- Participates in the development of the Individualized Service Plans (ISP) and monthly updates- Responsible for their designated group of residents during the shift, knows where their residents are and physically checks on them throughout the shift.- Partners with community team to ensure community is in compliance with OSHA requirements and promotion of Risk Management programs and policies; adherence to safety rules and regulations.- Responds to the dining needs of the residents and guests while maintaining Sunrise hospitality and service standards- Invite, Encourage, Assist (IEA) residents in life skills and other life enriching activities as indicated on ISP and demographic profile- Committed to serving our residents and guests through our Principles of Services 

Qualifications:- Dedication to and passion to serve seniors with excellent customer service skills - Positive attitude, the flexibility to perform various duties in service to the residents and the ability to work in a team environment are keys to success- Preferred - HCA Diploma, and registration with BC Care Registery.- Current Food Safe and First Aid Required.- Must be at least 18 years of age- Previous experience working with seniors preferred- Ability to make choices, decisions and act in the resident’s best interest- Possess written and verbal skills for effective communication and a level of understanding- Competent in organizational and time management skills- Demonstrate good judgment, problem solving and decision making skills

title: Weekend Live-in Caregiver
description:
Are you a caregiver looking for a unique position?

Assurance Home Care is an in-home care company focusing on high-end services for its client needs. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about what they do, understand, and respect the desire for independence while working closely with our clients. Our services include everything from companionship to housekeeping, meal preparation, medication reminders, personal care and grooming assistance and running errands. Check out our website for additional information: www.assurancehomecare.ca

***Competitive rate of pay with benefits***

Job Summary:

The caregiver would live in with the client.

The caregiver will provide various services for the client, most of which would provide personal care and activities of daily living, including but not limited to housekeeping, meal preparation and companionship. The following are various tasks that may be required:

  • Accompany clients on short trips, doctor’s appointments as necessary;
  • Assist clients in all activities of daily self-care activities, including but limited to toileting, bathing, grooming, and linen changes;
  • Prepare meals appropriate to the patient's diet, assist with meal preparation and clean-up;
  • Assist clients with transfers and exercises in a safe manner when required;
  • Perform housekeeping chores that the client is unable to perform, including vacuuming, making beds, laundry, dusting, mopping, cleaning the bathroom and the kitchen, caring for pets;
  • Willingness to work with multiple pets in the home;
  • Respond and collaborate positively to client’s constructive criticism and attend to client requests promptly;
  • Anticipate client needs and customize care to meet the client’s needs;

 

Qualifications :

  • Minimum of three years of Caregiving experience
  • Previous experience providing support in the capacity as a Personal Support Worker;
  • Ability to read, write and follow oral and written directions in English consistent with the job requirements;
  • Display good emotional health and be physically fit to do some heavy lifting;
  • Demonstrate flexibility in acceptance of assignments and a cooperative attitude toward providing services;
  • Ability to treat clients with respect and dignity; to provide boundaries and to adapt to new situations;
  • Training in dementia care

Immunization Requirements:
It is required to provide documentation that you have received two doses of the Covid-19 vaccine or proof of one dose.

    We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest, but only those who meet the requirements will be contacted.

    Assurance Home Care welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

    #HP

title: Resident Care Partner
description:
Job Description :

RESIDENT CARE PARTNER (Health Care Aide)

Amica West Vancouver

Imagine working for a growing, industry-leading organization where people join together for meaningful work!

Amica is the #1 choice of Canadian seniors who want to continue living on their terms in an elegant setting with discerning care, enriching activities and outstanding dining. Our 4,000 Amica Team Members currently serve 3,600 seniors in Ontario, Alberta and British Columbia. In over 31 residences, and growing, we provide premium independent living, assisted living and memory care living options.

 

 

Why should I join Amica?

  • We are committed to your personal and professional growth
  • Our nurturing environment encourages learning, innovation and excellence
  • Team members are supported by a culture of collaboration and teamwork
  • New ideas and approaches are encouraged by leaders
  • Our teams are diverse and reflective of the communities we serve; we embrace diversity and inclusion as an opportunity to innovate, thrive and grow  
  • Easy to use app available for you to pick up additional shifts at your residence and other Amica residences
  • Master scheduling that provides consistency
  • Local leaders that provide in-person leadership in service to you
  • Industry competitive wages and benefits

 

 

What does a day in the life of a Resident Care Partner (Health Care Aide) look like?

 

As the  Resident Care Partner  you have the opportunity to engage and interact with residents throughout their daily activities in a meaningful and supportive way.   Some of these activities include:

  • Getting to know each resident you serve
  • Asking residents how they are doing
  • Providing personalized care
  • Tidying suites
  • Participating in life enrichment activities together
  • Coordinating communication with loved ones
  • Reminding residents of and supporting them to meals or appointments.

 

 

What do I need to be a Resident Care Partner (Health Care Aide) at Amica?

  • Must be a graduate from a recognized Health Care Aide program; students currently enrolled in a nursing program and internationally certified nursing candidates with one-year Canadian nursing/PSW experience or more will be considered
  • Level 1 First Aid, CPR / AED Certificate
  • Good verbal and written communication skills â€“ English is essential
  • Interacts with others in an effective, compassionate, empathetic and supportive manner
  • Respects each resident as an individual and is aware of their need for self-respect and privacy, and the right to share in decisions about their care
  • Keen observation, decision making and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to develop harmonious relations with team members, residents and families
  • Demonstrates ability to organize workload and adapt to unexpected tasks and situations
  • Ability to use related technology and equipment
  • Medication administration with training provided through Amica

 

What Covid-19 precautions have been taken to keep you safe?

  • Remote interview process
  • Personal protective equipment (PPE) and in-depth, ongoing hand hygiene training provided
  • Daily screener completed by team members, residents and visitors
  • Vaccination rates of over 80% for team members and 97% for our residents in our residences
  • On site Covid-19 testing and vaccinations

 

 

Trust â€“ Compassion â€“ Excellence â€“ Teamwork â€“ Growth

 

Apply today!

 

https://www.amica.ca/careers

 

At Amica Senior Lifestyles we are passionate about working together in a supportive and inclusive environment that fosters innovation and turns ideas into action. We remain committed to creating workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate.   We are actively seeking applicants from all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, Black, Indigenous, racialized people, and persons with disabilities and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions.

 

Amica Senior Lifestyles recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents,  team members and visitors from COVID-19. Effective October 2021, a condition of employment  is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

 

Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

 

#RCP-Hiring-Amica

title: 5 day live in Caregiver/PSW
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in the life of a senior? At Home Care Assistance we believe in a balanced approach to aging to help seniors live longer in their own homes. Join us in changing the way the world ages!

APPLY TODAY - CALL 416-488-8777

Home Care Assistance has an opportunity for a LIVE IN Caregiver/PSW position for 5 days/week in available in the Toronto Area. You will work with a regular client one-on-one in their private home.

A Little about our client's current needs:

1) Wednesday 10:30am to Monday 10:30am Live in - Care is for a female client with arthritis. Care is mostly for companionship, meal preparation, light housekeeping, reminders and reassurance, some ambulatory support.

Located: Avenue and Eglinton

 

 

Whats in it for you?

  • Competitive salary
  • Meals Provided
  • Less travelling going to and from a client's home
  • Ongoing training and education
  • Professional advancement opportunities
  • Long hours -flexible to your needs and availability
  • Employee of the month program
  • Employee rewards/ referral bonus
  • Highly supportive staff team
  • 4% vacation pay

We deliver a holistic care approach to our clients and as such we are looking for candidates with strong technical skills as well as the personality traits that create genuine and long lasting care relationships. This role is perfect for motivated individuals looking to build a career as a Personal Support Worker while working around family and other personal obligations.

Job Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

  • Assistance with transfers and ambulation
  • Supervision and Safety
  • Medication Reminders and Management
  • Companionship and Engagement
  • Meal Preparation and Light Housekeeping
  • Personal Care and Hygiene

Job Requirements:

We're looking for the best! Heres what we'd like to see:

  • At least 1-2 year of professional elderly caregiving experience
  • PSW Certificate or other relevant training
  • Must be comfortable with the physical demands of the role, including the ability to assist clients with lifts/transfers, standing, walking, sitting and repositioning.
  • A positive attitude and the ability to prioritize clientâ€™s needs.
  • Clear Vulnerable Sector Police Check

Clients and cases are available right away -apply today and start as soon as next week. Flexibility is required too and we have days, nights and weekends available.

We offer a welcoming and supportive work environment with a dedicated and compassionate management team to support all our employees in their work. Our clients have high expectations and for many years we have delivered. We believe that the taking care of our clients begins with taking care of our employees.

**APPLY TODAY FOR AN OPPORTUNITY TO MEET OUR TEAM. KATHRYN IS REVIEWING APPLICATIONS DAILY.**

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

CALL 416-488-8777 TODAY!!!

OR APPLY TODAY ON WWW.HCAMATCH.COM

Home Care Assistance does not discriminate caregiver referrals on the basis of race, colour, religion, national origin, pregnancy status, sex, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender, identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

title: Home Care Aide
description:
Company description

Our experienced, professional caregivers come alongside friends and family to provide extra-mile care and support.

We serve Care Recipients across Vancouver. We are looking for gentle and experienced Caregivers.

Job description

Responsibilities:

- Visit care recipients in their homes and provide personal care as outlined in their care plans

- Provide practical care (laundry, cooking, cleaning...)

- Assist care recipients with ADL's

- Assist with transfers and light exercise

- Complete records and data entry thoroughly

Skills:

- Must be strong in English both verbally and in writing. Other languages are an asset.

- Must be patient and caring

Requirements:

- Certificate from accredited school or care aide program & experience providing care

- 2 professional references

- Criminal record check

- Fully vaccinated status

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $23.00-$25.00 per hour, depending on your level of experience.

Care Aide Wanted

This is a temporary, part-time, or full-time job, depending on your availability and experience. Night shifts, day shifts, and weekend shifts are available.

If you are interested please phone us at 604-505-1206 and apply on our website: https://www.brosscare.org/careers

Applicants must have experience as a Care Aide or have recently finished a care aide certification program . All applicants must be registered care aides in BC.

Hours: 10-40 hours per week depending on your availability

title: Infirmière Auxiliaire
description:
Infirmiere Auxiliaire  

Dynacare est actuellement à la recherche d'une infirmière auxiliaire. Il s'agit d'une poste dans notre  

centre de prélèvements LHSC à Montreal, Québec. Ceci est un poste de permanent - temps plein.  

Responsabilités:  

Saisie de données des réquisitions médicales  

Facturer les analyses et remettre les reçus aux patients  

Répond aux appels de façon courtoise et professionnelle  

Offrir des services de qualité aux patients et aux médecins selon les standards de GDML  

Collaborer à promouvoir les services offerts  

Établir des relations professionnelles avec les patients et tout le personnel médical du centre  

Donner les renseignements ou instructions aux patients  

Effectuer les prélèvements nasopharyngé, et/ou sanguin et/ourecevoir les spécimens biologiques et/ou  

aider le patient à produire un échantillon de gargarisme pour fin d'analyses diverses en respectant les  

normes en vigueur  

Préparer les échantillons : centrifuger, décanter, préparer leur envoi au laboratoire principal  

Maintenir le matériel et l’équipement en bon ordre de fonctionnement  

Imprimer les rapports administratifs (fin de journée) et compiler les statistiques  

Vérifier l’inventaire du matériel et préparer une commandehebdomadaire de fournitures  

Maintenir l’ordre et la propreté de l’endroit en tout temps  

Exigences:  

Membre de l’OIIAQ ou équivalent requis  

Expérience en service à la clientèle (expérience minimale de 6 mois à 1 an)  

Excellente maîtrise pour la prise de sang  

Personne autorisé(e) à faire des prélèvements sanguins  

Connaissances informatiques plus particulièrement de la suite Microsoft Office  

Atouts:  

Aptitudes exceptionnelles en service à la clientèle  

Capacité à créer une expérience positive aux patients  

Capacité de promouvoir les services de Dynacare ainsi que de développer des relations clients  




Capacité de servir un grand nombre de patients  

Capacité à désamorcer l'anxiété d'un client  

Capacité à expliquer clairement les détails importants et à s'assurer de leur compréhension  

Capacité démontrée à travailler au sein d’une équipe dans un environnement respectueux  

Capacité à respecter les processus relatifs à l'utilisation d'équipements de protection.  

ADN d’un employé idéal de Dynacare  

J’influe positivement sur la vie des gens. Je suis un membre d’équipe empathique et solidaire qui se  

passionne pour la qualité et l’amélioration continue.  

Empathie — Je me préoccupe vraiment du bien-être de mes collègues, des patients et des clients.  

Membre d’équipe solidaire — Je sais que je joue un rôle clé dans le succès de l’équipe Dynacare. Je suis  

à l’aise au sein d’un environnement changeant et je peux gérer de multiples priorités simultanément.

title: Live In Caregiver
description:
We are looking for a caregiver, preferably a personal support worker or a foreign trained nurse or physiotherapist to provide care for a gentleman with ALS. The family lives in Muskoka so this position is live in with two days off per week. The caregiver must be skilled in transferring. The position will involve assisting with mobility and providing full assist with self-care. Possible overnight shifts might be required. The family will pay bus fare (or mileage) to and from Muskoka. Males and females are welcome to apply.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

description:
Job details

Vacancies 6

English

title: Resident Services Worker Inverary Manor Long Term Care Home
description:
Inverary Manor Long Term Care Home

Resident Services Worker

Inverary Manor is a modern 71 Bed /Private Room Long Term Care Home located in Inverness NS, along Cape Breton’s Musical Coast in the heart of Inverness County.   Our team cares for some of the most vulnerable people in society.  It’s important and meaningful work we do.   

Currently we are seeking 6-8 candidates  to join our team to fill several openings for Part-Time  Resident Services Worker  positions.  We offer an extensive orientation and training program and immediate enrollment into our extensive benefits package for those hired.  Starting hourly wage is $16.41, increasing to $16.93 after completion of probationary period.  

You may have some or all of the experiences we need, feel you are a good fit for the job, and have a proven track record for learning on the job. If so, we invite you consider this opportunity:   

As a  Resident Services Worker  you will provide a range of critical services for our residents including, Housekeeping, Dietary and Laundry.  Ideal candidates will have the following:

 Ø  Experience in Hospitality Services such as Restaurant Services, Housekeeping Services, Laundry Services and Guest Services    

Ø  Experience working with elders and being in companionship with them 

Ø  Enjoy hands on work

Ø  Internally motivated, highly disciplined, tactful, conscientious and empathetic. 

Ø  Proven ability to work in a team environment 

Ø  Experience in Healthcare would be an asset

Ø  Food Handlers training and WHMIS certification would be an asset

To apply, click on the following link and complete the on-line interview :https://bit.ly/2zfFO8P

Inverary Manor values diversity in our workplace and we welcome all applicants.  Only those who are a deemed to be a fit for the position will be contacted.

title: Live-in Caregiver - Hamilton
company: Home Care Assistance GTA West, Waterloo & Guelph
description:
Home Care Assistance GTA West is currently looking for Personal Support Workers/Live-in Caregivers in the Hamilton area to do in-home Live-in care for an elderly family.

JOB SUMMARY

1) Caregiver must ensure the individual's health, safety and well-being.

2) Provide holistic support to the individual, conducting care with dignity, respect and provide emotional support.

3) Follow care plan and objectives as outlined by the care management team.

4) Empower the individual by assisting him/her to develop to his /her maximum level of independence in self-care, personal safety, household and community living skills.

5) Provide every opportunity for an individual to make choices and decisions regarding his/her life. Assist the individual in accepting the responsibilities of his/her choices.

6) Dementia based care for the client at home.

Qualifications, Job Skills and Abilities:

  • Retired PSWs/ Health Care Aides/ RPNs can apply
  • Sound Dementia experience and knowledge
  • Good verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work as a team member and complete tasks as assigned.
  • Good problem solving and conflict resolution skills.
  • Good time management and ability to multi-task.
  • Ability to work under pressure.
  • Respect for individual confidentiality.
  • Has G license and drives

Availability:

Monday-Friday with alternate weekends

Pay Rate:

$250/day

title: Live-in Caregiver
description:
Here at Home Care Assistance, we truly embrace our mission: Champions of Aging Well, and we would love for you to join us!

Our ideal candidate would be mature and reliable with a caring personality - somebody who is compassionate about the care of individuals and want to support them in living as independently as possible.

We offer company-paid benefits to our caregivers, initial and ongoing training, and flexibility with schedules, as well as opportunities for you to spend time in both continuing education events and social events, getting to know your peers.

Looking for a caring individual to join a live-in caregiving team for a senior lady!

Shifts would be a 2 or  3 days a week rotation where you will be with the client 24/7. Caregiver will be considered "off-duty" 8 hours per day but must remain on site to be responsive to emergencies. Off Duty time can be used to sleep, relax, make phone calls, watch TV but must remain on the premises. Private bedroom and food will be provided.

Duties include: meal preparation, grocery shopping, light housekeeping, and assistance with personal care.

*****Applicants must be legally able to work in Canada at the present and already reside in or near Winnipeg****

Job Requirements:

  • Bathing, grooming and hygiene
  • Dressing & undressing
  • Mobility assistance
  • Transferring and positioning
  • Toileting and incontinence care
  • Medication reminders
  • Companionship
  • Meal preparation
  • Laundry
  • Light housekeeping

A drivers license is required.

Phone: 204-489-6000

title: In-Home Caregiver (PT)
description:
Caregiver for Seniors (PT) Looking for a caregiver part-time on Saturdays from 11-4:30pm.

Looking for a mature female to take care of a female senior.

Job Description

In-Home Caregiver Position:
Just Like Family Home Care Chilliwack location is hiring amazing health care staff again! Want to look forward to your workday? At Just Like Family we do!

Be treated like a professional, respected for your individual talents and experience. We are a close-knit team of Home Support Workers, Caregivers, and nurses, who work together to ensure our clients have the highest quality of care from each and every team member.

We take pride in doing the “extra little things” that make all the difference to our clients. We provide quality in-home care services in the lower mainland.

Work for a local BC-based local company with benefits and room to advance with hard work and dedication.

Qualifications:
  • Seeking individuals wanting a long-term career opportunity that has flexibility, is compassionate, caring, and with a genuine interest in improving the quality of life of others.
  • We are seeking caregivers that are willing to take initiative, and work well independently or as part of a team.
  • Ability to speak and write well in English needed. The ability to speak another language is an asset!
  • Must be able to take the bus and /or drive to work.
  • Must live in the Chilliwack BC Area or immediate vicinity. No applicants living in foreign countries.
  • A smartphone with data is necessary for schedule and reporting purposes. 
  • A criminal record check is required and 2 professional references are required.

If you are detail-oriented, like working 1-1 with clients, are dependable, honest, nurturing, and fun-loving you are just the right person. Job types available: Full time, part-time positions.

We have ongoing relevant educational training modules to help you grow in your knowledge while you work.

Types of care we provide:
  • Companionship.
  • Light housekeeping.
  • Meal preparation.
  • be willing to learn to use a lift

Job Types: Part-time. day shift Saturday

Please email your resume.

Benefits:
  • Medical, dental, vision, prescriptions.
  • Flexible working hours.
Part-time hours: 5 hours per week.

Salary: $18.00-$22.00 per hour.

COVID-19 considerations:
Our caregivers complete a Covid-19 training module and are given PPE to use as needed with clients in their homes.

fvoffice@justlikefamily.ca
604-991-7070

title: Afternoon Evening Filipino Health Care Aide
description:
Are you looking for a career helping others? Can you speak Tagalog? Looking for a company that values passion and rewards its employees with great benefits? Your search is over â€“ a Health Care Aide with Home Care Assistance is the job for you!

We are the Champions of Aging! As a company, we adhere to the best business practices â€“ fully insured, we also cover all employees with workers' compensation and will take care of any related tax reporting. This strong commitment to hiring and developing only excellent caregivers has helped us become the premier provider of non-medical in-home senior care!

Job Benefits:

  • Competitive pay
  • Flexible hours
  • Work one-on-one with a client in his or her own home
  • Make a difference in a senior's life

Apply today â€“ seeking a Home Health Aide for full and part-time shifts!

Responsibilities of a Home Health Aide:

  • Establish open communication with seniors and their families
  • Assist clients with errands, light housekeeping, meal preparation, grocery shopping, transportation, ambulation, and transfers
  • Personal care including bathing, dressing, mobility, incontinence care, feeding and other services
  • Companionship and friendship for seniors and loved ones
  • Medication reminders

Job Requirements:

  • Tagalog Speaking 
  • A passion for the job and helping others
  • Health Care Aide Certification or equivalent 
  • Access to reliable transportation and valid insurance
  • Ability to pass a background check and reference check

Why Work for Home Care Assistance?

Home Care Assistance is strongly considering candidates with previous experience as an HCA, PSW, Personal Care Aide/Assistant, or a nurse from the country of origin.

Start your rewarding career with Home Care Assistance today. Apply now!
